title: Peranakan Reimagined: A Cultural Wonderland at Sensoryscape
description: Sentosa Sensoryscape transforms into a vibrant Peranakan wonderland from May to August 2025, featuring eye-catching installations, captivating light shows, engaging activities, hands-on workshops, and lively entertainment. This new immersive experience showcases all things Peranakan, from larger-than-life displays to interactive elements designed for the entire family. Visitors can explore colourful shophouses, intricate beaded shoes, and traditional kuihs, immersing themselves in the rich culture. Highlights include The Peranakan House, Tactile Trellis displaying detailed bead patterns, and the Scented Sphere with aromatic herbs. Interactive elements allow guests to learn about kebaya embroidery and the story behind Cherki cards. The event offers a comprehensive cultural journey through Peranakan heritage.

title: The Peranakan House Light Show at Sentosa Sensoryscape
description: Experience The Peranakan House Light Show, a daily spectacle held every 15 minutes that illuminates The Peranakan House, a life-sized shophouse at Sentosa Sensoryscape. Bursting with bold colours and intricate batik designs, this vibrant display creates an immersive atmosphere, transporting visitors into a real Peranakan home. The show is an integral part of the 'Peranakan Reimagined' event, offering a captivating visual and auditory experience. It complements the overall cultural exploration, featuring sounds of Nyonyas chatting, kitchenware clattering, and nostalgic songs, adding depth to the understanding of Peranakan heritage and traditions. It is a family-friendly attraction suitable for all ages, running from late May to late August.

title: Peranakan-themed Workshops at Sentosa Festive Market
description: Engage your creativity at the Peranakan-themed workshops available at the Festive Market within Sentosa Sensoryscape. These hands-on sessions offer a unique opportunity to delve into Peranakan craftsmanship. Activities include embroidery, mini clay kueh making, designing your own beaded slippers (kasut manek), crafting Peranakan tile-inspired coasters, and creating adorable kueh tutu felt plushies. Perfect for all ages, these interactive workshops provide a fun and educational way to connect with the rich cultural heritage. Participation in one workshop is free with a minimum spend of $20 at the Sentosa Festive Market, encouraging visitors to explore local crafts and engage actively with the Peranakan Reimagined event.
price_display: Free with $20 spend at Sentosa Festive Market

title: Peranakan Reimagined At Sensoryscape: A Cultural Wonderland
description: Sentosa Sensoryscape transforms into a vibrant Peranakan wonderland from May to August 2025, offering a captivating journey into Peranakan culture. Visitors can explore The Peranakan House, a life-sized shophouse bursting with bold colours and intricate batik designs. Inside, sounds of Nyonyas chatting and nostalgic songs create an immersive experience. Don't miss The Peranakan House Light Show, taking place every 15 minutes daily from 7:30 pm to 9:30 pm. Just a short walk away is Tactile Trellis, a stunning display of craftsmanship featuring hundreds of detailed kasut manek bead patterns, including a giant pair of beaded shoes and oversized tools highlighting the patience and artistry of the Nyonyas. Behind the Tactile Trellis, discover the captivating story of the kebaya, a symbol of Peranakan pride, and its evolution. Kids will love the touchable art mural depicting Peranakan heritage. For a full sensory experience, head behind the Scented Sphere where you'll be surrounded by the fresh scents of herbs and spices essential to Peranakan cooking, like pandan and lemongrass. At Symphony Streams, visitors can learn about Cherki cards, a game that tells stories across generations, and listen to ronggeng melodies that served as a backdrop for lively family gatherings. The event also features interactive workshops, such as embroidery and mini clay kueh making, and live performances by local Peranakan cultural pop group, Peranakan Sayang, on selected dates.

title: Hands-on Peranakan Themed Workshops at Festive Market
description: Participate in a variety of interactive Peranakan-themed workshops at the Festive Market, an integral part of the Peranakan Reimagined event at Sentosa Sensoryscape. These engaging sessions offer hands-on opportunities to explore traditional Peranakan crafts and artistry. Activities include embroidery workshops, mini clay kueh making, creating your own beaded slippers (kasut manek), designing Peranakan tile-inspired coasters, and crafting adorable kueh tutu felt plushies. Suitable for all ages, these workshops provide a unique cultural experience. Visitors can attend one workshop for free by simply spending $20 at the Sentosa Festive Market, making these accessible and enjoyable cultural sessions for families and individuals alike.
price_display: Free with $20 spend at Sentosa Festive Market

title: Night Safari Tram Adventure: Explore Nocturnal Animals in Themed Zones
description: Embark on a 30-minute guided Safari Adventure Tram ride through six themed zones at Night Safari Singapore, offering close-up views of nocturnal animals like Malayan tapirs, hyenas, and Asian elephants in their moonlit habitats. The open-sided tram provides comfy seats and stroller access, making it ideal for families. Enjoy unlimited rides from 7pm to 11.20pm, covering vast grounds with ease and comfort. It's a perfect way to experience the park's diverse wildlife and lush jungle-like habitats, observing animals you'd never see awake during the day.
venue_name: Night Safari, 80 Mandai Lake Rd, Singapore 729826

title: Creatures of the Night Show: Interactive Nocturnal Animal Presentation
description: The Creatures of the Night show is an engaging 20-minute presentation held at the Night Safari Amphitheatre, offering an exciting introduction to the park's nocturnal residents. Visitors will meet fascinating animals like the binturong, fennec fox, and Indian crested porcupine. Keepers share intriguing facts and demonstrate the animals' natural behaviors, providing a unique educational experience. This interactive session is designed for the entire family, combining entertainment with valuable insights into wildlife conservation. With three showings every evening, it's a highlight of the Night Safari visit. It's advisable to book your seats online in advance to ensure availability, as this popular show fills up quickly, especially the earlier slots.
venue_name: Night Safari Amphitheatre, Night Safari, 80 Mandai Lake Rd, Singapore 729826

title: Twilight Performance: Electrifying LED Light and Fire Spectacle

This is a perfect opportunity to escape the tropical heat and have a fun-filled snowy adventure with your family. Engage in exciting snow activities and create unforgettable memories in Singapore's only indoor snow attraction. Please note that this offer is valid now until August 31, 2025, excluding June 2025. Don't miss out on this unique and refreshing experience for the whole family.
price_display: $60 for 2 adults & 2 children for 1 hour of Snow Play

title: Trickeye Singapore: $60 for 2 Adults + 1 Child for Online Purchases (SG60)
description: Immerse yourself in a world of optical illusions and interactive art at Trickeye Singapore with their special SG60 deal: get admission for 2 adults and 1 child for just $60. This fantastic offer is exclusively available for online purchases, making it convenient to plan your visit. Trickeye Museum provides a unique and engaging experience where you can become part of the artworks and capture amazing photos. It's a perfect outing for families and friends looking for a fun and creative way to spend their day. This promotion is valid now until August 31, 2025. Book your tickets online and get ready for a memorable adventure.
price_display: $60 for 2 adults + 1 child for online purchases only

title: Madame Tussauds Singapore: $60 for 2 Tickets + Marvel 4D Access (SG60)
description: Step into the world of fame and fantasy at Madame Tussauds Singapore with their exclusive SG60 deal: get 2 tickets for just $60, which also includes access to the thrilling Marvel 4D experience. Meet your favorite celebrities, historical figures, and superheroes in lifelike wax figures, and immerse yourself in the action-packed Marvel 4D show. This is an incredible opportunity to enjoy a full day of entertainment and interactive fun at a special price. This promotion is valid from March 15 to August 31, 2025. Don't miss out on this star-studded experience for the whole family.

title: Changi Experience Studio: $60 for 6 Tickets (SG60)
description: Embark on an immersive journey through the wonders of Changi Airport at the Changi Experience Studio with their fantastic SG60 deal: get 6 tickets for just $60! This interactive attraction offers a unique blend of technology and entertainment, allowing visitors to discover the magic behind Changi Airport's operations. It's a perfect outing for families and friends, providing an educational and engaging experience for all ages. This special promotion is valid from March 14 to September 30, 2025. Don't miss this opportunity to explore the behind-the-scenes world of one of the world's best airports at an unbeatable price.

title: Sentosa 4D AdventureLand: $60 for 2 Pax 4-in-1 Combo (SG60)
description: Experience thrilling adventures at Sentosa 4D AdventureLand with their special SG60 deal: get a 4-in-1 combo ticket for 2 persons for just $60! Immerse yourselves in a world of high-tech entertainment with motion-simulated rides, interactive shows, and 4D movies. This combo provides access to all the exciting attractions, offering a full day of fun and excitement for couples, friends, or family members. This promotion is valid now until September 30, 2025, providing ample time to plan your visit. Don't miss this opportunity to embark on an unforgettable journey at Sentosa's premier 4D attraction.

title: Singapore Cable Car: $60 Cable Car Sky Pass Round-Trip + 3-Course Arbora Meal (SG60)
description: Elevate your Singapore experience with the Singapore Cable Car's exclusive SG60 deal: enjoy a Cable Car Sky Pass round-trip combined with a delightful 3-course meal at Arbora for just $60! Soar above the city and enjoy breathtaking panoramic views as you travel between Mount Faber Peak and Sentosa Island. Afterwards, indulge in a delicious meal at Arbora, a scenic restaurant nestled amidst lush greenery. This package offers a perfect blend of sightseeing and dining, ideal for a romantic outing or a special family treat. This promotion is valid from June 1 to December 31, 2025. Don't miss this unique opportunity to experience Singapore from new heights.
price_display: $60 Cable Car Sky Pass round-trip + 3-course Arbora meal

title: BOUNCE Singapore: $60 for 2 Pax for 2 Hours (SG60)
description: Unleash your inner child and experience exhilarating fun at BOUNCE Singapore with their special SG60 deal: get 2 hours of bouncing fun for 2 persons for just $60! BOUNCE offers an incredible trampoline park experience with various zones and activities suitable for all ages and skill levels, from free jumping to dodgeball and slam dunk. It's the perfect place to enjoy an active and exciting outing with a friend or loved one. This promotion is valid from July 1 to August 8, 2025. Don't miss out on this fantastic opportunity to defy gravity and have a blast at a great price.

title: SkyHelix Sentosa: $6 Off Tickets (SG60)
description: Ascend to new heights and enjoy breathtaking 360-degree views of Sentosa and the Southern Islands with SkyHelix Sentosa's SG60 promotion: get $6 off your ticket! This open-air, rotating gondola ride offers a unique and memorable experience, perfect for capturing stunning panoramic photographs. It's an ideal activity for those seeking a tranquil yet thrilling way to take in Singapore's beautiful skyline. This offer is valid from June 1 to September 30, 2025. Additionally, from October 13 to December 31, 2025, you can get $16 tickets which include a Sentosa Line round trip. Don't miss out on these fantastic deals to experience SkyHelix Sentosa.
price_display: $6 off SkyHelix Sentosa; $16 tickets + Sentosa Line round trip
datetime_display: $6 off: 1 June – 30 September 2025; $16 tickets: 13 Oct – 31 December 2025

title: Singapore River Cruise: 39% Off Tickets for Singapore Citizens
description: Discover Singapore's iconic landmarks from a unique perspective with the Singapore River Cruise, now offering a special deal exclusively for Singapore citizens. Enjoy a fantastic 39% off tickets, with adult fares at just $17 (U.P. $28) and child fares at $11 (U.P. $18). Sail down the historic Singapore River and take in the stunning views of the city's modern architecture and rich heritage. It's an excellent opportunity for both locals and residents to experience a relaxing and informative tour at a significantly reduced price. This promotion is valid now until December 31, 2025. Don't miss out on this scenic and affordable adventure.

title: ArtScience Museum: Up to 4 Kids Enter Free on Fridays with Adult Ticket
description: Plan an enriching family day out at the ArtScience Museum, renowned for its kid-friendly exhibits and interactive installations. On Fridays, up to four children can enter for free with every adult ticket purchased, making it an incredibly affordable and engaging cultural experience for the whole family. Immerse yourselves in a captivating blend of art and science, exploring various thought-provoking exhibitions that spark curiosity and creativity in all ages. This ongoing promotion provides an excellent opportunity to discover new perspectives and enjoy a memorable artsy day out. Secure your tickets and prepare for an inspiring visit.
price_display: Up to 4 kids enter free with every adult ticket (U.P. unknown)

title: Lasertech-X: 5% Off Laser Tag Activities (Sassy Mama Exclusive!)
description: Experience the thrill of laser tag anywhere you desire with Lasertech-X, offering a fantastic 5% discount on any laser tag activity exclusively for Sassy Mama readers. Whether you prefer to organize a game at a park, a multipurpose hall, or enjoy their dedicated laser tag battlefield at their premises, Lasertech-X provides a flexible and exciting experience for all. Kids are welcome to join in the fun, making it an ideal activity for family outings or group events. Simply quote 'SASSYMAMA' to receive your discount and embark on an action-packed laser tag adventure.
price_display: 5% off any laser tag activity (U.P. unknown)
venue_name: Lasertech-X premises or location of choice

title: Free Movie Tickets in Singapore at Various Cinemas (Off-Peak Deals)
description: Did you know it's possible to enjoy free movie tickets in Singapore? Take advantage of various off-peak deals at popular cinema chains such as Golden Village, Shaw Theatres, WE Cinemas, and Cathay Cineplexes. Young children who meet specific criteria can watch movies for free, making it an excellent and affordable entertainment option for families. This initiative allows more people to enjoy the magic of the big screen without the usual cost. Check the specific terms and conditions with each cinema chain for eligibility and showtimes. Don't miss out on this fantastic opportunity to catch your favorite films for free!
organiser: Golden Village, Shaw Theatres, WE Cinemas, Cathay Cineplexes

title: Stitch-themed Children's Festival at Gardens by the Bay: The Great Ohana Wave
description: Children's Festival 2025 at Gardens by the Bay features the adorable Stitch from Disney's Lilo & Stitch. Explore large-scale installations, including a 7-meter-tall “surf” slide, an inflatable forest, a 'Space Adventure', and a sensory “beach” made of kinetic sand. This festival promises a fun and engaging experience for kids and families, offering various interactive elements inspired by the beloved character. It's a great opportunity for children to immerse themselves in a world of imagination and play amidst the beautiful surroundings of Gardens by the Bay.
venue_name: Supertree Grove, Gardens by the Bay

title: Jurassic World: The Experience at Cloud Forest, Gardens by the Bay
description: The Cloud Forest at Gardens by the Bay transforms into a dinosaur park for this immersive experience. Encounter life-sized dinosaurs, including an impressive 8.5-meter-tall Brachiosaurus and a majestic T-Rex. There's even a petting zoo where you can interact with baby dinosaurs. Keep an eye out for plant species that date back to the Jurassic Period, adding an educational element to the adventure. Standard admission rates for Cloud Forest apply, offering a unique opportunity to step back in time and experience the world of dinosaurs up close.
venue_name: Cloud Forest, Gardens by the Bay

title: i Light Singapore 2025: Interactive Light Installations at Marina Bay
description: i Light Singapore 2025 returns with 17 captivating light installations across Marina Bay, South Beach, Raffles Place, and the Singapore River. This year's festival is themed around SG60, promising a dazzling display of multi-sensory experiences. Visitors can look forward to exploring an illuminated garden, a piano walk, a reverse waterfall, and many more innovative light art pieces. It's a fantastic opportunity for families and individuals to enjoy an evening stroll while admiring the creative and environmentally conscious light art. The festival promotes sustainability through its use of energy-efficient lighting technologies.
datetime_display: 29 May – 21 June, Sunday – Thursday 7.30pm – 11pm, Friday – Saturday 7.30pm – 12am
venue_name: Marina Bay, South Beach, Raffles Place & Singapore River

title: Flipside 2025: Circus Shows, Acrobatics & Kids' Theatre at Esplanade
description: Flipside 2025 offers a diverse array of free performances for families looking for entertainment this weekend. The festival showcases a variety of kid-friendly theatre shows, including exhilarating circus performances, engaging comedy acts, impressive acrobatics and aerial shows, and imaginative puppetry. With a wide range of acts, there's something to captivate every child and adult. This free festival provides an excellent opportunity to experience the arts in a vibrant and accessible setting, encouraging a love for live performances in young audiences.

title: Super Kids Expo: Free Workshops & Activities for Families
description: The Super Kids Expo is a free family event packed with engaging activities and workshops for children. Kids can participate in a chemistry lab, batik painting, storytelling sessions, and more. The expo also features lively kids' performances, appearances by popular mascots, and various freebies for families. Parents will find it beneficial to explore the latest kids' services and products, attend informative talks, and even contribute to a good cause by donating pre-loved toys and books. It's a comprehensive event designed for family fun and discovery.

title: Bluey's Beach Party at NEX: Bouncy Castle, Meet-and-Greet & Workshops
description: Bluey's Beach Party at NEX offers an exciting experience for young fans. The highlight is a Bluey bouncy castle, complete with a giant slide and beach-themed obstacles, promising endless fun. Children can also look forward to special Bluey and Bingo meet-and-greet sessions on June 7 and 8 at 1pm, 4pm, and 7pm. Additionally, kids can unleash their creativity in Bluey workshops, where they can build a windchime (June 7 and 8) or a paper plate drum (June 14 and 15). All activities are exclusively for NEXrewards members, and sign-ups are free, with a minimum spend of $50 in a single transaction required for participation.
price_display: Requires minimum $50 spend for NEXrewards members (sign-ups free)

title: Rasa Sayang Sunday Market: Handmade Crafts, Jewellery & Fashion
description: The Rasa Sayang Sunday Market is a vibrant weekend market featuring a variety of handmade and ethically produced crafts, unique jewellery, and fashionable items. It's a wonderful opportunity to discover unique products from local creators and small businesses. The market provides a platform for artisans to showcase their work and for visitors to find special, sustainable goods. It's a perfect outing for families and individuals looking for distinctive items and a pleasant atmosphere.

title: Sentosa Festive Market: Pre-loved Goodies & Hidden Treasures
description: The Sentosa Festive Market is back at Palawan Beach Walk, offering a treasure trove of pre-loved goodies and hidden gems. Visitors can explore a variety of stalls selling unique items, from vintage finds to handcrafted goods. It's an excellent opportunity to discover sustainable and one-of-a-kind products while enjoying the vibrant atmosphere of Sentosa. This market provides a fun and leisurely way to spend the weekend, perfect for families and bargain hunters alike.

title: Vintage Flea Market at Katong Square: Lifestyle & Vintage Finds
description: The Vintage Flea Market at Katong Square offers a delightful selection of lifestyle and vintage items. Shoppers can browse through a diverse range of unique products, including fashion, collectibles, and home decor. It's a fantastic spot for finding one-of-a-kind treasures and experiencing the charm of a flea market. The market's extended hours on Fridays and Saturdays make it an ideal destination for an evening outing, while Sundays offer a relaxed daytime shopping experience for families and enthusiasts of vintage goods.

title: Gallery Children's Biennale: Multi-sensory Installations at National Gallery
description: Gallery Children's Biennale at National Gallery Singapore invites children of all ages to explore eight multi-sensory installations. The 2025 theme, “Tomorrow, We'll Be…”, focuses on Joy, Kindness, Love, and Dream, creating an engaging and inspiring environment. Notably, this year marks the first time all installations are designed to be baby-friendly, ensuring a welcoming experience for the youngest visitors. The Biennale provides a unique opportunity for families to engage with art in a playful and interactive manner, fostering creativity and exploration in a stimulating setting.

title: Children's Season 2025: Arts & Crafts at Children's Museum Singapore
description: Children's Season 2025 at Children's Museum Singapore, themed 'Belonging', offers a month filled with engaging programs for children. Throughout June, kids can participate in a variety of free workshops and craft activities designed to stimulate their natural curiosity and creativity. Highlights include building a 'time-travelling machine', crafting paper lighthouses, painting sessions, and a self-guided activity focused on a UFO. In addition to the free programs, ticketed activities are also available, providing ample opportunities for children to explore and learn in a fun museum environment.

title: How To Train Your Dragon Toothless Touring Truck & Isle of Berk Viking Village
description: The 'How To Train Your Dragon' Toothless Touring Truck is making appearances at various malls, offering Viking-themed fun for kids. Children can conquer Viking riddles and puzzles, navigate a maze game, craft Viking bracelets, and get temporary AR tattoos. At Bugis+, the Isle of Berk Viking Village features fun themed photo spots, craft workshops, a dragon training zone, and other games that encourage movement and balance. These events provide an immersive and interactive experience for fans of the 'How To Train Your Dragon' series, allowing them to engage with their favorite characters and themes.
price_display: Free (some activities may have separate charges)
datetime_display: Toothless Touring Truck: 30 May – 1 June at CQ @ Clarke Quay; 2 – 8 June at Funan; 9 – 15 June at Plaza Singapura; 16 – 22 June at Bugis+; 23 – 29 June at Lot One. Isle of Berk Viking Village: 9 – 29 June
venue_name: Various CapitaLand Malls (CQ @ Clarke Quay, Funan, Plaza Singapura, Bugis+, Lot One)

title: Live Mermaid Shows by The Dancing Mermaid at Cosford Container Park
description: Cosford Container Park hosts enchanting live mermaid shows by The Dancing Mermaid every Saturday and Sunday. These hour-long performances take place in an actual water tank, offering a unique and captivating experience for mermaid-loving children and families. It's a magical opportunity to witness mermaids gracefully swimming and interacting, bringing a touch of fantasy to the weekend. The shows provide entertainment and a chance to marvel at the artistry of the performers in an unconventional setting.
datetime_display: 31 May till the end of the year, Saturday 7.30pm – 8.30pm; Sunday 7pm – 8pm

title: GastroBeats 2025: Food, Live Music & Local Creators at Bayfront Event Space
description: GastroBeats 2025, an integral part of i Light Singapore 2025, is a vibrant festival offering a haven for foodies and music lovers. It features a wide array of food stalls, live music performances, and products from local creators and small businesses. The event is also pet-friendly, allowing families to bring their furry companions along. Visitors can enjoy a lively atmosphere at sunset before exploring the stunning i Light Singapore 2025 light installations around the Marina Bay area, combining culinary delights with artistic spectacles.

title: Jumptopia Lite: Bounce Beyond at Suntec City Atrium
description: Jumptopia Lite: Bounce Beyond is a pop-up inflatable playground at Suntec City, designed to provide immense fun for children. The playground features inflatable desserts, towering slides, winding tunnels, and a vibrant rainbow ball pit, ensuring an exciting and active play experience. Tickets are priced at $15 for a 30-minute play session, with special perks available for Suntec+ members and DBS/POSB Cardmembers. Visitors are reminded to bring non-slip socks for participation. This event offers a fantastic indoor activity for kids to burn off energy and enjoy imaginative play.
price_display: $15 for a 30-minute play session (perks for Suntec+ & DBS/POSB Cardmembers)

title: National Family Festival 2025: Family Fun Across Singapore
description: The National Family Festival 2025 is a nationwide event kicking off at Singapore EXPO and extending to various locations across Singapore from May 31 to June 29. This free kids' event is designed to offer the perfect recipe for family fun, featuring bouncy castles, creative crafts, exciting challenges, and sports trials. The Children's Festival 2025 is also part of the lineup, ensuring a wide array of activities for all ages. It's a fantastic initiative to promote family bonding and provides numerous opportunities for children to engage in active and creative play.
datetime_display: 31 May – 1 June @ Singapore EXPO & Westgate; 7 – 8 June @ Kallang Wave Mall; 21 – 22 June @ Lot One
venue_name: Singapore EXPO, Westgate, Kallang Wave Mall, Lot One (various locations)

title: Bluey Outdoor Adventures at SAFRA Punggol: Kayaking, Painting & Meet-and-Greet
description: Bluey and his family are visiting SAFRA Punggol throughout the June holidays, offering a series of exciting outdoor adventures for families. Parents and children can embark on the Bluey Kayaking Adventure at Punggol Waterway, participate in The Bluey Painting Workshop to unleash their creativity, and capture memorable moments with Bluey and Bingo at the free Meet & Greet sessions. This event provides a wonderful opportunity for children to engage in active and artistic activities inspired by their favorite characters in an outdoor setting.
price_display: Free Meet & Greet (other activities may vary)

title: ACM & Me: New Play Space at Asian Civilisations Museum
description: The Asian Civilisations Museum introduces a new children's play space, ACM & Me, featuring three thematic zones: 'Who am I?', 'What's my story?', and 'What can I create?'. Families can engage in creative activities such as creating self-portraits using magnetic shapes, reimagining mythical creatures, and immersing themselves in a space of colors, lights, and music. Entry to the ACM & Me play space within ACM's permanent galleries is free for Singaporeans and Permanent Residents, with standard rates applicable otherwise. It offers an interactive and enriching experience for children to explore identity, history, and creativity through play.
price_display: Free for Singaporeans and PRs; standard rates apply otherwise

title: National Museum of Singapore's Children's Season: Installations & Treasure Hunt
description: The National Museum of Singapore's Children's Season offers a variety of free activities for young visitors. Children can explore an interactive installation about early migrants in Singapore, take the lead at a Mama Shop replica, embark on an exciting artefact hunt, and enjoy character meet-and-greet sessions. Storytelling and screening sessions are also available, enhancing the learning experience. While many programs are free, ticketed options such as sensory play stations and additional workshops are also offered, providing diverse opportunities for children to engage with history and culture in a fun way.

title: Disney's Stitch 626 Party at VivoCity: Photo Zones & Game Stations
description: VivoCity invites Stitch fans to a wholesome cosmic fun event featuring Disney's mischievous alien. Visitors can snap countless photos at the 626 Party photo zones, including an impressive 4.5-meter-tall Stitch installation, perfect for capturing memorable moments. The event also offers Stitch-themed game stations (separate charges apply) and a Mini Express Train ride for additional entertainment. Furthermore, attendees can explore the Miniso Stitch Fluffy Pop-Up, the first of its kind in Singapore, to purchase exclusive Stitch merchandise and blind boxes. It's a vibrant event for fans of all ages to celebrate Stitch.

title: Cultural Extravaganza 2025: Kid-friendly Performances at SCCC
description: Cultural Extravaganza 2025 at the Singapore Chinese Cultural Centre offers free engaging performances designed to introduce children to local Chinese arts and culture in a relaxed setting. The annual program includes sensory-based theatrical performances like 'The Spice Mission', focusing on sambal chilli, a show depicting Singapore's evolution from kampong days to modern housing, and a fun dance performance by children. This festival provides an accessible and enjoyable way for families to explore and appreciate Chinese heritage through diverse artistic expressions, fostering cultural understanding and appreciation.
datetime_display: 9 May – 7 June, Various dates and timings

title: Gateway Kids Club: Free Storytelling Sessions Celebrating Dad
description: Gateway Kids Club offers free storytelling sessions every Saturday at Gateway Theatre. Each month features a different theme, and in June, the focus is on celebrating dads. Children can enjoy engaging stories centered around the man of the family, providing a heartwarming and educational experience. These sessions are a wonderful way to foster a love for reading and storytelling in a welcoming environment, while also celebrating family bonds. Registration is required to secure a spot for these popular events.

title: Movies by the Beach at Sentosa: Free Outdoor Movie Screenings
description: Sentosa offers free outdoor movie screenings at Palawan Kidz City Roof Garden every Saturday and Sunday at 7pm, perfect for a relaxing weekend outing. Families can bring their picnic blankets and baskets to enjoy a selection of family-friendly movies, including action flicks and comedies. No pre-bookings are required, allowing for spontaneous enjoyment of cinema under the stars. This event provides a delightful and cost-effective way to spend quality time with loved ones in a scenic beachside setting, combining entertainment with the great outdoors.
venue_name: Palawan Kidz City Roof Garden, Sentosa

title: National Library Board: Free Storytelling & Activities
description: Singapore's public libraries, equipped with a vast collection of kids' books and magazines, offer a wonderful array of free activities for children of all ages. These libraries boast kid-friendly facilities, including inviting reading corners, vibrant decor, and educational zones. Beyond reading, families can enjoy free storytelling sessions, making libraries an ideal rainy-day activity. Special June events include 'Rugged Reptiles: The Scaly Squad' for ages 3-4, 'Police Pals @ Libraries' offering glimpses into the Singapore Police Force, 'Ooey, Gooey, Slimy Science!' for ages 5-6, and a 'Marine Biodiversity Carnival'.
datetime_display: Various dates in June (e.g., 14 June, 13, 14 & 19 June, 21 June, 28 June)
venue_name: Various Public Libraries (Sengkang, Punggol, Yishun, Jurong West, Central)

title: Nightflix Somerset: Free Outdoor Movie Screening at Somerset Youth Park
description: Nightflix Somerset offers a free outdoor movie screening at Somerset Youth Park every first Saturday of the month until December 2025, starting at 7:30 PM. This event is perfect for families looking for a relaxed weekend activity in Singapore. Attendees simply need to bring their own headphones, a picnic mat, and movie buddies to enjoy the film under the stars. To secure a spot, registration via the Cinewav app is required. It's a fantastic, free way to enjoy a movie night in a casual and open-air setting.
datetime_display: Every first Saturday of the month till 31 December 2025, 7.30pm

title: Fire Station Open House: Guided Tours & Emergency Vehicle Demos
description: Selected Fire Stations in Singapore host open houses on Saturday mornings, offering free guided tours for children and families. Visitors can choose between two time slots: 9am to 9:50am or 10am to 10:50am. This unique experience allows tots to learn about emergency vehicles and their capabilities, witness demonstrations on donning full firefighting protective gear, and see how equipment like massive water sprays are used firsthand. It's an exciting and educational outing that provides a glimpse into the daily operations of a fire station and the important work of firefighters.
datetime_display: Saturdays every weekend, 9am to 9:50am or 10am to 10:50am

title: Pop Air Exhibition by the Balloon Museum at Marina Bay Sands
description: The new Pop Air exhibition by the Balloon Museum promises a whimsical weekend experience for families at Marina Bay Sands. This exhibition features large-scale inflatable installations, interactive artworks, and a profusion of baubles and balloons, ensuring a memorable visit for children and adults alike. Highlights include a sprawling 1,000sqm space filled with latex balloons and cloud swings, providing unique photo opportunities and playful interactions. Tickets are priced at $63 for adults and $48 for children, offering a delightful and immersive art experience.

title: Playgrounds of the Past, Bounced into the Present at Marina Square
description: Marina Square's central atrium transforms into 'Playgrounds of the Past, Bounced into the Present', offering a nostalgic and fun experience for the whole family. This unique event features three bouncy playgrounds designed to resemble Singapore's iconic playgrounds: the Dragon Slide, Pelican Maze, and Elephant Playground, reimagined in a modern and inflatable form. In addition to the bouncy fun, visitors can enjoy old-school games onsite. Admission to the playgrounds is $6 for a 30-minute session (U.P. $10) for Marina Square Rewards Members, making it an affordable and entertaining activity for both parents and kids.
price_display: $6 for a 30-minute session (Marina Square Rewards Members)

title: Singapore Oceanarium: Triple-Sized Aquatic Wonders at Resorts World Sentosa
description: S.E.A. Aquarium has undergone a significant transformation and reopened as the Singapore Oceanarium, now three times larger than its previous iteration. This beloved kids' attraction at Resorts World Sentosa features 22 distinct zones, promising an enhanced and immersive experience. Exciting new additions include 'Ancient Waters' and 'Conquering Land', showcasing prehistoric ocean animals and zones designed to foster a deeper emotional connection with marine life. It's a must-visit for dinosaur-loving children and anyone eager to explore the vast and diverse underwater world.

title: Chinatown Heritage Centre: Step Back in Time to 1950s Singapore
description: The Chinatown Heritage Centre has reopened, offering visitors a unique opportunity to journey back in time to 1950s Singapore. The center showcases artifacts and meticulously recreated interiors of restored shophouses, giving a vivid glimpse into the daily lives of early residents. This immersive experience allows families to show children what life used to be like, complete with authentic details and a sense of historical authenticity. Admission is affordable at $12 for Singapore Residents, making it an accessible and educational outing for those interested in Singapore's rich heritage.
venue_name: Chinatown Heritage Centre, 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207

title: SuperPark Singapore: Revamped Indoor Playground with 13 New Installations
description: SuperPark Singapore has undergone a massive upgrade and reopened with 13 new installations across its three revamped signature zones. The Freestyle Hall now offers climbing walls and trampolines for adventurous kids. The Games Arena features 18 interactive stations designed to test agility, accuracy, and teamwork, promoting both physical activity and collaborative play. The Adventure Area serves as a huge playground for kids to explore and engage in various activities. Additionally, the all-new Super Recharge Cafe provides kid-friendly grub like hotdogs and pizzas, along with refreshing drinks, making it a complete destination for family fun and refueling.

title: New Comics & Games Library Pop-Up at Punggol Coast Mall by NLB
description: Punggol Coast Mall is home to a new pop-up Comics and Games Library, a must-visit for fans of comic books and games. This library features an extensive collection of over 7,000 comics, game-themed books, and graphic novels, including popular titles and kids' favorites like Dog Man and Bluey. In addition to reading materials, visitors can enjoy a variety of board games available for play, providing a fun and interactive experience. It's a fantastic new spot for families to explore new stories and engage in playful learning.

title: PropNex Family Zone at Gardens by the Bay: New Inclusive Outdoor Playground
description: The newly opened PropNex Family Zone at Gardens by the Bay offers an exciting outdoor playground for children, designed with inclusivity in mind. Inspired by the iconic Supertrees, this playground features various climbing and play structures that accommodate kids of all abilities. The playground also boasts a magical transformation after sunset, lighting up just like the Supertrees themselves, creating a captivating evening experience. It's a fantastic new addition to Gardens by the Bay, providing a free, engaging, and accessible space for families to play and enjoy the outdoors.

title: Rainforest Wild Asia: Explore Natural Habitats & Wildlife Zones
description: The highly anticipated Rainforest Wild Asia is now open, offering immersive zones that replicate the natural habitats of wildlife from across Asia. Visitors can explore beautiful limestone formations, home to Francois langurs, and the Rock Cascade, where majestic tigers reside. Children will particularly enjoy exploring zones like the Forest Floor and The Cavern, a realistic replica of Sarawak's famous Mulu Caves. Tickets are available online, with special offers including one free child ticket with the purchase of two adult tickets (prices from $43) and KrisFlyer miles promotions for DBS/POSB Cardmembers. It's an unparalleled opportunity to connect with diverse Asian wildlife in a captivating setting.
venue_name: Rainforest Wild Asia, 20 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729825

title: New Art Installations at Punggol Waterway: A Blend of History & Nature
description: Punggol Waterway is now adorned with three new art installations that children and adults alike will appreciate. Near Waterway Point, giant colored pencils offer snippets of Punggol's past mangrove habitats. Towards the Adventure Bridge, a striking crocodile arch pays homage to the reptiles that once thrived in Punggol's mangroves. Finally, at SAFRA Punggol, the Flora and Fauna Kinetics Playscape features kinetic bugs, bringing a playful touch of nature to the area. These installations blend art with local history and ecology, providing an engaging and educational experience along the scenic waterway.
venue_name: Waterway Point, Adventure Bridge, SAFRA Punggol

title: Mandai Boardwalk: Stroller-Friendly Trail at Upper Seletar Reservoir
description: The newly opened Mandai Boardwalk offers a refreshing 3.3km-long trail, ideal for a leisurely stroll through the Upper Seletar Reservoir and the Central Catchment Nature Reserve. Designed to be stroller-friendly, it provides an accessible outdoor experience for families with young children. Along the trail, visitors will discover five thematic stations and a lookout point, each inspired by the local wildlife, offering educational insights and opportunities for nature appreciation. It's a perfect way to enjoy fresh air and scenic views while exploring Singapore's natural beauty.
venue_name: Trail entrances at Mandai Wildlife East and River Wonders

title: Big Sister's Island: Snorkelling, Nature Trails & Beaches Reopened
description: After a three-year closure, Big Sister's Island has officially reopened, inviting families to a weekend of snorkelling and exploring its natural beauty. The island boasts pristine beaches, serene lagoons, and vibrant corals, offering ample opportunities for marine exploration. A 230-meter forest trail provides a tranquil escape, making visitors feel far removed from the urban bustle of Singapore. Accessible via a 30-minute boat ride from Marina South Pier, Big Sister's Island is an ideal destination for nature lovers and adventurous families seeking a serene island getaway with rich biodiversity.
venue_name: Big Sister's Island (via Marina South Pier)

title: Giant Chess & Lawn Bowls at Sports Hub: Free Outdoor Games
description: Sports Hub offers free outdoor facilities including giant chess sets and lawn bowls, perfect for family-friendly games. Giant chess sets can be pre-booked, providing a unique blend of brainpower and physical activity as players use both hands and feet to move the large pieces. In addition to chess and lawn bowls, the Sports Hub features various other free outdoor facilities such as basketball courts, beach volleyball courts, and a playground. It's a fantastic venue for families to engage in active fun and enjoy a variety of sports and games together in the open air.
venue_name: Singapore Sports Museum rooftop, 6 Stadium Walk, Singapore

title: Borealis Northern Lights at Supertree Grove: Free Immersive Light & Sound Show
description: Borealis at Gardens by the Bay is a captivating free immersive light and sound installation at Supertree Grove, created by Switzerland-based artist Dan Ache. It recreates the magical splendor of the Northern Lights using layers of light and cloud particles, offering a mesmerizing visual and auditory experience. This show takes place on Mondays from 8pm to 8:30pm, and every Saturday and Sunday from 9pm to 9:30pm. It complements the daily 'Garden Rhapsody' light and sound show, where the Supertrees dance to a changing musical soundtrack, making for an unforgettable evening at Gardens by the Bay.
venue_name: Supertree Grove, Gardens by the Bay

title: Mandai ZooSchool: Singapore's first wildlife adventure school offering exciting learning programmes for kids aged 3 to 12 at Mandai Lake Road
description: Mandai ZooSchool offers exciting adventure programmes for kids aged 3 to 12. Children can choose a two-hour program with a card game challenge to learn animal facts or a full-day program including wildlife interactions, basic first aid training, and zookeeper talks. Upcoming parent-tots nature-play sessions are also in the works. This unique learning experience provides hands-on engagement with wildlife and educational activities designed to foster a love for animals and nature.
venue_name: Mandai ZooSchool, 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826

title: Jurassic World: The Experience at Cloud Forest, Gardens by the Bay, featuring life-sized animatronic dinosaurs and a petting zoo
description: Jurassic World: The Experience at Cloud Forest in Gardens by the Bay allows dino fans to marvel at life-sized animatronic dinosaurs, including an 8.5-meter tall Brachiosaurus and a terrifying Tyrannosaurus rex. Visitors can also spot tiny Composognathus hidden within the pathways and get up close with baby dinosaurs at the Petting Zoo area. The exhibition provides an immersive journey into the prehistoric world within the cool and relaxing atmosphere of the Cloud Forest, making it an ideal family attraction.
price_display: Varies based on Gardens by the Bay admission and specific experience tickets
venue_name: Cloud Forest at Gardens by the Bay, 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953

title: Singapore Symphony Orchestra Family Concerts: Engaging musical adventures for all ages at Esplanade Concert Hall & Victoria Concert Hall
description: The Singapore Symphony Orchestra presents a series of family concerts designed to introduce music to all ages. 'Young Spacefarer's Guide to the Orchestra' (6 September 2025, 11am & 2pm) offers a symphonic space adventure. 'SSO Babies' Proms' (13 & 14 September 2025, 11am & 2pm) is an energetic session for babies and their parents. For Halloween, 'Temasek Foundation × SSO: Halloween Spooktacular!' (1 November 2025, 11am & 2pm; 2 November 2025, 11am) provides a spine-tingling experience. In 2026, 'Wild Symphony with Maestro Mouse' (21 March 2026, 11am & 2pm; 22 March 2026, 11am) brings Dan Brown's book to life with poetry, visuals, and melodies. Pre-show activities, including an Instrument Petting Zoo, are available one hour before performances.
price_display: Varies depending on concert, free for children under 2 for SSO Babies' Proms with adult ticket
age_group_display: All ages (Concerts for Children: 5+, SSO Babies' Proms: 0-6)
datetime_display: Various dates in September 2025, November 2025, and March 2026
venue_name: Esplanade Concert Hall & Victoria Concert Hall

title: Gallery Children's Biennale 2025: Eight interactive and baby-friendly art installations at National Gallery Singapore for all ages to explore
description: Gallery Children's Biennale 2025 at National Gallery Singapore features eight interactive art installations for children of all ages, centered around the theme “Tomorrow We'll Be” and highlighting values of Joy, Kindness, Dream, and Love. For the first time, all installations are baby-friendly, allowing even the youngest visitors to engage with multi-sensorial art. The biennale also includes engaging programs such as storytelling workshops, adventure trails, and craft activities, encouraging creativity and exploration through art.
venue_name: National Gallery Singapore, 1 Saint Andrew's Road, Singapore 178957

title: ACM & ME: New family-friendly interactive play space at Asian Civilisations Museum, inviting discovery through hands-on activities, sensory experiences and art, music, and play
description: ACM & ME is a new family-friendly space at the Asian Civilisations Museum designed for all ages to discover themselves through hands-on activities and sensory experiences. The space features three thematic zones: “Who am I?”, “What's my story?”, and “What can I create?”. Each zone encourages creativity through art, music, and play, offering limitless possibilities for exploration and self-expression. This interactive environment promotes engagement and learning in an enjoyable setting.
venue_name: Asian Civilisations Museum, 1 Empress Place, Singapore 179555

title: Mandai Wildlife Group: New wildlife experiences and SG60 promotions starting June 7, 2025, offering up-close animal encounters and ticket deals for families
description: Mandai Wildlife Group celebrates SG60 with new wildlife experiences and promotions starting June 7, 2025. 'Hello from the Wild' offers 20-minute up-close encounters with capybaras at River Wonders and fennec foxes and ring-tailed lemurs at Singapore Zoo. 'Backstage Pass: Penguin Encounters' provides a chance to meet penguins at Bird Paradise. Special deals include two admission tickets to Singapore Zoo or River Wonders for $60, and seniors can get the 'Friends of Mandai' five-park membership for $60.
price_display: Various promotions; 2 admission tickets for Singapore Zoo or River Wonders at $60; 'Friends of Mandai' five-park membership for seniors at $60
venue_name: Mandai Wildlife Group, 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826

title: SuperPark Singapore: Revamped indoor playground with 13 new attractions and an in-park café, offering 34 exhilarating activities for families at Suntec City Mall
description: SuperPark Singapore reopens with a revamp, featuring 34 exhilarating activities, including 13 brand-new installations and an in-park café. Spanning 25,000 square feet, this indoor playground offers an interactive games arena, an adventure zone with a climbing wall, and a new Airbag Donut Slide, promising unstoppable fun for the entire family. It's designed to provide a dynamic and engaging experience that kids will want to revisit repeatedly, ensuring a memorable time for all.
venue_name: SuperPark Singapore, 3 Temasek Boulevard, #01-488 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983

title: ArtScience Museum: New collaborative installation 'Artland' by Do Ho Suh and his daughters and revamped 'Future World' exhibition, showcasing art and nature through clay creations and teamLab installations
description: ArtScience Museum introduces 'Artland,' a new installation by South Korean artist Do Ho Suh and his daughters, featuring fantastical plants, creatures, and landscapes sculpted from colorful clay, inviting visitors to contribute. Additionally, the acclaimed 'Future World: Where Art Meets Science' exhibition has been revamped with major new installations by teamLab that explore the beauty of nature. These exhibits provide a unique blend of art and science, encouraging creativity and interaction for all ages.

title: Retykle: Pre-loved pop-up shop at Plaza Singapura offering 50-90% off designer kids' fashion brands with new pieces added weekly and a virtual closet for easy reselling
description: Retykle's pop-up shop at Plaza Singapura offers 50-90% off over 2,500 pre-loved and new designer kids' fashion brands, including Bonpoint, Ralph Lauren, Jacadi, and Moncler. New pieces are added weekly, providing continuous opportunities to update children's wardrobes. All purchases, both online and in-store, are saved to a Retykle Virtual Closet, enabling easy reselling once kids outgrow the items. This initiative promotes sustainable fashion by giving clothes a second life.
venue_name: Retykle at Plaza Singapura, 68 Orchard Road, #04-14, Singapore 238839

title: Flipside 2025: Les Patineurs – Roller skate battle at Esplanade
description: Experience the excitement of Flipside 2025 at Esplanade with Les Patineurs, a thrilling roller skate battle. This performing arts festival features free live performances including comedy, puppetry, and circus acts, perfect for a fun-filled weekend. Witness amazing acrobatics, juggling, and balancing acts, and even try out circus skills workshops. Les Patineurs is a highlight of the festival, promising a unique and dynamic display of talent and entertainment for all ages.

title: Flipside 2025: Ketch Comedy Show – Clowning, juggling, magic and more
description: Catch the Ketch Comedy Show at Flipside 2025, a performing arts festival at Esplanade offering free live performances. This show promises an entertaining mix of clowning, juggling, and magic, perfect for a family outing. Flipside 2025 features a variety of acts including puppetry and circus shows, ensuring a weekend full of laughter and amazement. Don't miss this opportunity to enjoy high-energy performances and impressive skills, creating memorable moments for everyone.
venue_name: Esplanade Concourse, DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade

title: Flipside 2025: Aerial Open Stage – Dazzling aerial performance
description: Experience the Aerial Open Stage at Flipside 2025, part of the Esplanade's performing arts festival. This event showcases breathtaking aerial performances, adding a spectacular element to your weekend plans. Flipside 2025 offers a variety of free live shows, including comedy, puppetry, and circus acts, making it an ideal destination for family entertainment. Witness skilled aerialists defy gravity with stunning routines, providing an unforgettable visual experience that highlights the artistry and athleticism of these performers.
venue_name: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade

title: Flipside 2025: Witty Look Show – Unicycle acrobatics and humour
description: Enjoy the Witty Look Show at Flipside 2025, featuring impressive unicycle acrobatics. This free performing arts festival at Esplanade offers a diverse range of live shows, including comedy, puppetry, and circus acts, perfect for family entertainment. The Witty Look Show combines skilled unicycle stunts with comedic elements, ensuring a lively and engaging performance. Don't miss this opportunity to see unique talents and enjoy a fun-filled day out, experiencing the vibrant atmosphere of Flipside 2025.

title: Flipside 2025: Stylish Comedy Show – Comedy magicians and jugglers
description: Witness the Stylish Comedy Show at Flipside 2025, featuring a dynamic duo of comedy magicians and jugglers. This free performing arts festival at Esplanade offers a wide array of live performances, including puppetry and circus acts, making it an excellent choice for family entertainment. The show combines hilarious comedic timing with impressive magic tricks and juggling feats, guaranteeing an engaging and entertaining experience. Immerse yourself in the festive atmosphere and enjoy the unique talents on display.
venue_name: Esplanade Concourse, DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade

title: Flipside 2025: OVVIO – Mastering balancing tricks and illusions
description: Discover OVVIO at Flipside 2025, a captivating show focused on intricate balancing tricks and illusions. As part of the free performing arts festival at Esplanade, this performance offers a unique blend of skill and artistry. Flipside 2025 features a diverse range of live acts, including comedy, puppetry, and circus performances, providing engaging entertainment for the whole family. Be amazed by the precision and creativity of the performers as they execute gravity-defying feats, making for a memorable experience.
venue_name: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade

title: Flipside 2025: A Show with Strings – Engaging puppetry and clowning
description: Delight in 'A Show with Strings' at Flipside 2025, an enchanting blend of puppetry and clowning. This free performing arts festival at Esplanade offers a variety of live shows, including comedy and circus acts, making it an ideal family outing. The show features charming puppets and humorous clowning, creating an engaging and interactive experience for all. Explore the diverse performances at Flipside 2025 and enjoy a weekend filled with artistic wonder and laughter, perfect for sparking imagination.

title: Children's Season at CMSG: 'For a Better Future' interactive performance
description: Immerse your kids in 'For a Better Future' at Children's Museum Singapore's Children's Season 2025. This interactive performance encourages children to actively participate in the show, fostering engagement and creativity. The Children's Season offers a variety of kids' musicals and theatre performances, alongside hands-on play centered around Singapore's food heritage. It's a wonderful opportunity for children to learn and have fun through immersive storytelling and collaborative activities, creating lasting memories.

title: Children's Season at CMSG: 'Tools and Treats: A Tasty Journey' and heritage snack kit
description: Embark on 'Tools and Treats: A Tasty Journey' at Children's Museum Singapore's Children's Season 2025. This experience combines engaging kids' musicals and theatre performances with hands-on play exploring Singapore's food heritage. Children will get to bring home a heritage snack kit, extending the learning and fun. The Children's Season offers a rich program designed to entertain and educate, making it a perfect family outing to discover local culture through interactive activities and delicious treats.

title: Anne Maria Lim and the Magic Organ kids' concert with SSO Organ Series
description: Introduce your children to the enchanting world of classical music at Anne Maria Lim and the Magic Organ concert, part of the SSO Organ Series. This magical evening tells the tale of wizard Mr. Majeika by Bob Chilcott, promising an engaging performance. The event includes fringe activities such as exhibitions and pipe organ demonstrations, making it a comprehensive and educational experience. It’s an ideal opportunity to spark a love for music in young audiences and explore the fascinating pipe organ.

title: Lang Lang Plays Disney In Concert: Iconic Disney songs with legendary pianist
description: Experience the magic of Lang Lang Plays Disney In Concert, where the renowned Chinese pianist performs iconic Disney songs. This special two-day event features beloved tunes such as 'Let It Go,' 'We Don't Talk About Bruno,' and 'When You Wish Upon a Star,' brought to life by Lang Lang's masterful artistry. It's a must-see for Disney fans and classical music enthusiasts alike, offering a unique blend of enchanting melodies and virtuoso performance. Secure your tickets for an unforgettable musical journey.
venue_name: The Star Theatre, The Star Performing Arts Centre

title: Peter & Blue's School Holiday 2025: Kids' ballet performance by Singapore Ballet
description: Celebrate the school holidays with Peter & Blue's School Holiday 2025, a delightful kid-friendly ballet performance by the Singapore Ballet. Follow Peter and his faithful dog, Blue, on their exciting escapades filled with laughter, friendship, and imaginative play. This charming ballet offers a perfect family outing, blending artistic expression with an engaging storyline. It's an excellent opportunity to introduce young audiences to the beauty of ballet in a captivating and accessible way.

title: The Puppet Master – A Night With Disney Songs: Cello pop orchestra performance
description: Join Cellography, Singapore's first cello pop orchestra, for 'The Puppet Master – A Night With Disney Songs.' This musical story follows a puppet's journey with his creator, reimagining classic Disney songs like 'Beauty and the Beast' and 'A Whole New World' by local composer Hughes Chong. Dress up as your favorite characters for this family-friendly show, filled with adventure, tough choices, and a touch of magic. It's a heartwarming performance that combines music, storytelling, and beloved tunes.

title: Symphony in the Gardens: FREE classical concert by Singapore Symphony Orchestra
description: Enjoy a perfect FREE weekend activity at Symphony in the Gardens with the Singapore Symphony Orchestra (SSO). Pack a picnic, gather your family and furkids, and head to the beautiful Shaw Foundation Symphony Stage at Singapore Botanic Gardens. Experience live classical tunes in a relaxed outdoor setting, making it an ideal way to introduce children to orchestral music. This concert offers a unique blend of nature and culture, providing a delightful and accessible musical experience for everyone.
venue_name: Shaw Foundation Symphony Stage, Singapore Botanic Gardens

title: Roald Dahl's Fantastic Mr Fox: Musical stage adaptation by Singapore Repertory Theatre
description: Join the cunning Mr. Fox in Roald Dahl's Fantastic Mr Fox, a lively musical stage adaptation by Singapore Repertory Theatre. Performed at Victoria Theatre, this kids' play follows Mr. Fox as he outsmarts greedy farmers to save his family. Filled with music, song, dance, humor, and memorable characters, it's a heartwarming tale about saving the animal community. Available also in Mandarin, this show promises to be a hit with little ones, combining adventure with valuable lessons.

title: Magic Hour @ Raffles Hotel Singapore: Free kids' classical concert with SSO
description: Experience the charm of Magic Hour at Raffles Hotel Singapore, a free kids' classical concert held every other month. Bring your little ones to enjoy classical music performed by the Singapore Symphony Orchestra (SSO) on The Lawn at Raffles Arcade. Pack a picnic and savor light bites and drinks available at the venue. This event offers a delightful way to introduce children to classical music in a relaxed and elegant setting, providing a perfect family day out.
organiser: Raffles Hotel Singapore, Singapore Symphony Orchestra
venue_name: The Lawn, Raffles Arcade at Raffles Hotel

title: Disney's Fantasia film screening with live orchestra by Singapore Symphony Orchestra
description: Watch Disney's iconic Fantasia film accompanied by a live classical music performance by the Singapore Symphony Orchestra (SSO). This August, immerse yourself in the visually captivating film featuring iconic tunes by Beethoven, Stravinsky, Tchaikovsky, and Bach. The two-hour show, including a 20-minute intermission, is ideal for older kids. It offers a unique opportunity to experience cinematic magic enhanced by the power of a live orchestra, creating an unforgettable sensory journey for the audience.

title: Koko The Great: Kids' theatre show about overcoming fear and embracing fun
description: Join Koko on his adventurous journey in Koko The Great, a perfect kids' theatre show for big imaginations. Follow Koko, a little village boy, as he confronts his fear of the unknown and discovers unexpected fun along the way. This engaging performance is designed to inspire young audiences to embrace new experiences and the joy of discovery. It's a heartwarming tale that encourages courage and imagination, making it an ideal family outing at Esplanade Theatre Studio.

title: Disney Jr. Live On Tour: 'Let's Play!' with Mickey, Minnie, and Team Spidey
description: Join Mickey, Minnie, Goofy, the Puppy Dog Pals, and Team Spidey from 'Marvel's Spidey and His Amazing Friends' for Disney Jr. Live On Tour: 'Let's Play!' This energetic kids' theatre show promises the biggest playdate ever, filled with fun and adventure. Discover if Team Spidey can uncover the mystery behind ominous weather and save the day. It's an exciting opportunity for young fans to see their favorite characters live on stage, ensuring a memorable and interactive experience for the whole family.
venue_name: Singapore Indoor Stadium, 2 Stadium Walk, Singapore 397691

title: The Tiger Who Came to Tea: Playful stage adaptation with songs, magic, and laughs
description: Experience the classic story come to life in 'The Tiger Who Came to Tea,' a playful stage adaptation perfect for kids aged 3 and up. Witness the delightful chaos that ensues when a tiger arrives for tea, filled with catchy songs, enchanting magic, and plenty of laughs. This engaging show runs just under an hour without intervals, ensuring young audiences remain captivated. It's a charming and lively performance that promises a memorable family outing.

title: SSO Babies' Proms: Interactive kids' concert for littles to explore instruments
description: The Singapore Symphony Orchestra's (SSO) Babies' Proms is back, inviting families to an interactive kids' concert where little ones can move along to the music and explore various orchestra instruments. This engaging event is designed to introduce young children to classical music in a fun and relaxed environment, encouraging participation and curiosity. It's a wonderful opportunity for families to enjoy beautiful melodies and foster an early appreciation for the arts together.

title: Ballet Under the Stars: Family-friendly ballet performance at Fort Canning Green
description: Enjoy a relaxed picnic vibe at Ballet Under the Stars, a family-friendly ballet performance at Fort Canning Green. The Singapore Ballet will showcase both classic and modern pieces, including 'Paquita' and 'Incomparable Beauty,' offering a delightful introduction to ballet for your little ones. It's a perfect night out to appreciate beautiful dance performances amidst fresh air, creating a wholesome and culturally enriching experience for the whole family in a serene outdoor setting.

title: CoComelon & Blippi Sing-A-Long Live: Kids musical with JJ and friends
description: Get ready for a treat at CoComelon & Blippi Sing-A-Long Live, a musical featuring JJ and friends taking the stage for the first time in Singapore. Warm up your voices and groove to favorite songs like 'If You're Happy and You Know It,' 'Wheels on the Bus,' and 'Head, Shoulders, Knees and Toes.' This interactive and high-energy show promises a fun-filled experience for young fans and their families, ensuring a memorable sing-along and dance party.
venue_name: Sands Theatre at Marina Bay Sands, 10 Bayfront Ave, B1-69/70 The Shoppes, Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018971

title: Cirque Alice: Alice in Wonderland meets acrobatics, contortionists, and aerialists
description: Step into a 'Wonderland' of acrobatics, contortionists, puppetry, and aerialists with Cirque Alice, where Alice in Wonderland meets a spectacular circus show. Be mesmerized by gravity-defying performers and enjoy classical hits with a contemporary spin. This unique production promises to keep you on the edge of your seat, blending a beloved story with breathtaking physical feats. It's a magical and thrilling experience for all ages, offering a fresh take on a classic tale.

title: The Three Billy Goats Gruff: Fun musical spin by Singapore Repertory Theatre
description: Relive the classic childhood tale with 'The Three Billy Goats Gruff,' given a fun musical spin by the Singapore Repertory Theatre. Follow the three goats' adventurous journey to cross a bridge in search of food, where they encounter a terrifying troll. Expect plenty of laughs and catchy tunes by award-winning duo George Stiles and Anthony Drewe. This engaging musical promises to be a delightful experience for young audiences, blending humor with a timeless story.
datetime_display: From 10 October 2025, Monday – Friday 9:30am & 11:30am; Saturday – Sunday 11am & 2pm

title: Temasek Foundation x SSO Halloween Spooktacular! Kids' spooky concert
description: Celebrate Halloween in a fun way with the Temasek Foundation x SSO Halloween Spooktacular! Bring your kiddos to this spooky kids' concert presented by the Singapore Symphony Orchestra. Get ready for witches, ghouls, skeletons, and more in a relaxed performance where kids can move and enjoy. Don't forget to wear your best Halloween costume for this festive and engaging musical experience, perfect for a family-friendly celebration of the spooky season.

title: The Emperor's New Clothes: Musical spin by Wild Rice for year-end holidays
description: Get ready for a musical spin on Hans Christian Andersen's classic folktale with Wild Rice's production of 'The Emperor's New Clothes.' Just in time for the year-end holiday season, this kids' play features a flamboyant Emperor tricked by two cheeky tailors. Expect an evening filled with laughter, catchy tunes, and fashionable fits. It's a delightful and humorous adaptation that promises to entertain the whole family, delivering a valuable lesson with wit and charm.

title: Beauty and the Beast The Musical: Magical Asia-exclusive stop
description: Step into a magical world this December as Beauty and the Beast The Musical makes its only stop in Asia in Singapore. Get ready to sing along to favorite songs like 'Be Our Guest' with dazzling costumes, amazing sets, and beloved characters brought to life in a new way. This fairytale adventure is a kids' theatre musical you won't want to miss, promising an enchanting experience for the whole family.
datetime_display: 11 December 2025 – 4 January 2026, various days and timings

title: SSO Christmas Concert: Celebrate year-end festivities with wintry tunes
description: Celebrate the year-end festivities at the SSO Christmas Concert at the Esplanade Concert Hall. You can expect your favorite wintry tunes to make an appearance, and you're even encouraged to sing along! This festive concert by the Singapore Symphony Orchestra offers a heartwarming musical experience for the whole family, perfect for getting into the holiday spirit. Immerse yourself in the joyful melodies and embrace the festive cheer.

title: Candlelight Concerts: Magical music experience by candlelight in Singapore
description: Take the kids to one of the many Candlelight Concerts for a magical experience of listening to music by candlelight in different locations around Singapore, from SEA Aquarium to Chijmes. Best for kids 8 years old or older, these concerts offer a unique and enchanting ambiance. It's a wonderful opportunity to introduce children to classical and contemporary music in a truly captivating setting, creating a memorable and serene musical journey.

title: Unforgettable Family Fun: PA Family PLAYGround 2025 at Tengah Community Club
description: Kick off the school holidays with an exciting family day out at the PA Family PLAYGround 2025! This event offers a fantastic opportunity to bond with your children and connect with other parents through a variety of engaging activities. From nostalgic childhood games like life-sized board games and Mega Jenga to creative workshops such as Paper Quilling and Acrylic Pour Painting, there's something for every age. Older kids can even try their hand at a DIY Recycling Bin workshop, while parents and children can participate in a workout class. Reflect and express gratitude at the SG60 Wishing Wall, or contribute to a good cause through the 'CARE in Every Bottle' initiative, supporting the Community Chest. Don't miss this chance to create lasting memories and foster community spirit!

title: Engaging Activities for All: PA Family PLAYGround 2025 at Braddell Heights Community Club
description: Discover a world of fun and learning at the PA Family PLAYGround 2025! Perfect for the school holidays, this event encourages family bonding and community interaction. Participate in lively games such as life-sized board games and Mega Jenga, or unleash your creativity with hands-on workshops like Paper Quilling and Acrylic Pour Painting. For the environmentally conscious, there's a DIY Recycling Bin workshop for older kids, and for those seeking an active lifestyle, a parent-child workout class. Take a moment for reflection and gratitude at the SG60 Wishing Wall and Digital Pledge Wall. Support the Community Chest by purchasing and decorating a juice bottle through the 'CARE in Every Bottle' initiative. Join us for a day of joy, connection, and community spirit!

title: Family Fun and Learning: PA Family PLAYGround 2025 at Toa Payoh West Community Club
description: Make the most of the school holidays at the PA Family PLAYGround 2025, an event designed for family bonding and community engagement. Enjoy a variety of free activities suitable for all ages, including exciting life-sized board games and challenging rounds of Mega Jenga. Unleash artistic talents with workshops like Paper Quilling and Acrylic Pour Painting. Older children can learn practical skills at the DIY Recycling Bin workshop, while active families can join a parent-child workout class. Express your gratitude at the SG60 Wishing Wall and Digital Pledge Wall, and contribute to a worthy cause by participating in the 'CARE in Every Bottle' initiative, where proceeds benefit the Community Chest. A day of fun, learning, and community awaits!

description: Join us for an incredible family day out at the PA Family PLAYGround 2025, a perfect way to spend the school holidays! This event is packed with free activities designed for family bonding and community interaction. Challenge your family to life-sized board games or a competitive game of Mega Jenga. Foster creativity with hands-on workshops such as Paper Quilling and Acrylic Pour Painting. Older kids can engage in a DIY Recycling Bin workshop, and active families can participate in a parent-child workout class. Reflect and share messages of gratitude at the SG60 Wishing Wall and Digital Pledge Wall. Support the Community Chest by purchasing and decorating a juice bottle as part of the 'CARE in Every Bottle' initiative. Come and create cherished memories!

title: Memorable Family Adventures: PA Family PLAYGround 2025 at One Punggol
description: Conclude your school holidays with a bang at the PA Family PLAYGround 2025, a vibrant event focused on family bonding and community engagement! Enjoy a wide array of free activities for all ages, including engaging life-sized board games and thrilling rounds of Mega Jenga. Unleash your creativity with interactive workshops like Paper Quilling and Acrylic Pour Painting. Older children can participate in a DIY Recycling Bin workshop, and active families can join a parent-child workout class. title: Abrakadoodle Singapore: Learn about different artists and their styles
description: Abrakadoodle Singapore offers non-obligatory art trial classes ($58 for 1 class, $120 for 3 classes) where kids learn about different artists and their art styles. They are exposed to a variety of art materials and mediums, developing confidence by sharing ideas and masterpieces during gallery time. This program aims to encourage your child's creative talents in painting, pottery, drawing, and decoupage, fostering essential motor skills, language development, spatial awareness, and decision-making, providing a well-rounded and engaging artistic experience for young learners.
price_display: $58 for 1 trial class, $120 for 3 trial classes
venue_name: Multiple locations in Singapore including Orchard, River Valley and Jurong East

title: The Art People: Learn animation and game design through The Artlytical Method
description: The Art People, founded in 2011 by passionate art teachers, inspires young children through art. They utilize The Artlytical Method® for specialized training in art, including Animation and Game Design. Emphasizing 'No one should be deprived of learning,' this school caters to both mainstream and special needs students. Their classes cultivate creative talents in painting, pottery, drawing, and decoupage, while also developing crucial motor skills, language abilities, spatial awareness, and decision-making. This holistic approach ensures a supportive and inclusive environment for every child's artistic journey.
venue_name: Multiple locations in Singapore including Ang Mo Kio, Beauty World and Tampines

title: Artary: Themed art courses and holiday options for young artists
description: Artary provides holistic and thoughtful art classes for kids aged 3.5 to 12 years old. Membership grants access to other studio activities, and plenty of holiday options like art jams and themed courses are available, using games, stories, and songs for engagement. Trial sessions allow children and parents to experience the messy fun before committing to a program. These engaging programs help with motor skills, language development, spatial awareness, and decision-making, fostering creativity through painting, pottery, drawing, and decoupage, ensuring a fun and enriching experience for young artists.
venue_name: Multiple locations in Singapore including Admiralty, Punggol, and Jurong

title: Artify: Regular art classes and one-off art jams for kids with small group sizes
description: Artify on Jalan Sultan offers regular art classes for kids aged 4 and up, along with one-off art jams where all materials and guidance are provided, requiring only imagination. They pride themselves on a low one art instructor to four little artists ratio, ensuring extensive personal attention. This focused environment nurtures creativity through painting, pottery, drawing, and decoupage, while also developing crucial motor skills, language abilities, spatial awareness, and decision-making. Artify provides a supportive and inspiring setting for children to explore their artistic potential and express themselves freely.

The diverse curriculum cultivates creative talents in painting, pottery, drawing, and decoupage, and importantly, develops motor skills, language abilities, spatial awareness, and decision-making. Their comprehensive offerings ensure a suitable and enriching artistic experience for every age group, fostering lifelong appreciation for art.

Painting and drawing form the foundation of each class, and they even offer the option to frame your child's artwork at the end of each session. The program aims to encourage children's creative talents in various art forms, fostering motor skills, language development, spatial awareness, and decision-making, providing a comprehensive and supportive environment for artistic exploration and growth. This studio ensures a rewarding experience for every young artist.

The program aims to encourage children's creative talents in various art forms, fostering motor skills, language development, spatial awareness, and decision-making, providing a supportive environment for artistic growth and genuine self-expression. description: My Art Pencil in Hougang is highly regarded by parents for its respectful approach to art classes for kids aged 3 years old to teens. The studio offers art jams, art supplies, and birthday party packages, providing a nurturing environment for artistic development.
