title: Bird Discovery Tour: An Expert-Guided Wildlife Journey
description: Embark on an immersive and exclusive Bird Discovery Tour to truly connect with the feathered residents of Bird Paradise. Walk through the park alongside your very own dedicated wildlife guide, who will provide an in-depth and engaging commentary, sharing all the fascinating inside scoop about their avian friends. This personalized experience allows for a deeper understanding of the diverse bird species, their habitats, and the conservation efforts undertaken to protect them. It offers a unique opportunity to explore the park with expert insights, making for an enriching and unforgettable educational journey for all participants.
price_display: From $320 (Mon-Fri) / $400 (Sat-Sun & PH) for up to 8 pax
age_group_display: All ages (suitable for up to 8 pax)

title: Backstage Pass: Avian Healthcare & Nutrition Centre Visit
description: Gain exclusive behind-the-scenes access to the vital operations that keep the birds of Bird Paradise healthy and thriving. This immersive experience allows you to witness firsthand how expert bird keepers ensure the well-being of their charges. Meet the dedicated veterinarians at the Avian Hospital, observe them in action as they provide specialized care, and learn about their crucial role in avian health. Furthermore, discover how wildlife nutritionists meticulously prepare balanced meals for the park's diverse residents at the Nutrition Centre, offering a comprehensive insight into the meticulous care provided to all the feathered inhabitants.
venue_name: Avian Hospital & Nutrition Centre, Bird Paradise

title: Children's Festival 2025 at Gardens by the Bay: Disney's Stitch
description: Gardens by the Bay's signature Children's Festival returns for its 11th edition during the mid-year school holidays, running from 24 May to 15 June 2025, 10am to 9pm daily. This year, the festival features Disney's Stitch, bringing to life large-scale installations, interactive play areas, and engaging activities at Supertree Grove. Families can explore the value of friendship and family, discover how to appreciate and accept themselves, and enjoy various free and ticketed experiences. Highlights include thrilling slides, inflatable forests, swing cars, kinetic sand play, meet and greet sessions, dance performances, and a special-edition Garden Rhapsody light and sound show. Installations close at 7pm daily. [1]
price_display: FREE to look around; some activities are ticketed
venue_name: Supertree Grove, Gardens by the Bay [1]

title: The Great 'Ohana Wave: Stitch-Themed Giant Slide at Gardens by the Bay
description: Experience the thrill of 'The Great 'Ohana Wave', a nearly 7-metre-tall, 28-metre-long slide wrapping around an iconic Supertree. Designed for adventurous children aged 6 to 12, this thrilling ride allows young adventurers to 'surf' their way down in a safe and exhilarating experience, providing a confidence boost and plenty of fun. This large-scale installation is a highlight of the Children's Festival 2025, bringing Stitch's surfing escapades to life. It offers a unique and memorable adventure for kids amidst the vibrant festival atmosphere at Supertree Grove. [1, 3]
venue_name: Supertree Grove, Gardens by the Bay [1]

title: Forest of Belonging: Inflatable Playforest at GBTB Festival
description: Step into the 'Forest of Belonging', an enchanting inflatable playscape where visitors can uncover hidden messages and embark on a journey with Stitch to discover the meaning of 'ohana'. This interactive installation provides a fun and imaginative environment for children to explore and learn about friendship and acceptance. Part of the Children's Festival 2025, this activity encourages discovery and play within a unique, immersive setting. It's a wonderful opportunity for kids to engage with the festival's themes in a dynamic and memorable way. This inflatable forest is a fantastic spot for families to enjoy together, fostering connection. [1, 3]
venue_name: Supertree Grove, Gardens by the Bay [1]

title: Space Adventure: Swing Car Mission at Children's Festival 2025
description: Embark on an exciting 'Space Adventure' at the Children's Festival 2025, where you can hop aboard a swing car to power up light beams and complete thrilling missions. This interactive play zone offers a dynamic and engaging experience for children, combining physical activity with an imaginative space theme. It's an opportunity for young adventurers to test their skills and teamwork while having immense fun. This installation provides a unique blend of entertainment and challenge, making it a memorable part of the festival experience for all participating kids and families. Located at Supertree Grove, it's a must-try attraction. [1, 3]
venue_name: Supertree Grove, Gardens by the Bay [1]

title: Stitch's Mischief Makers: Kinetic Sand Play at GBTB Festival
description: Little ones will adore 'Stitch's Mischief Makers', a delightful 'beach' area featuring kinetic sand for sensory and tactile play. This creative zone allows children to get hands-on and express their creativity through imaginative building and sculpting, inspired by Stitch's playful nature. It's a perfect environment for fostering sensory awareness and fine motor skills in a fun and engaging way. Part of the Children's Festival 2025, this activity provides a stimulating and enjoyable experience for younger visitors, allowing them to explore and create in a relaxed, beach-themed setting at Supertree Grove. [1, 3]
venue_name: Supertree Grove, Gardens by the Bay [1]

title: Lilo & Stitch Character Meet and Greet Sessions at GBTB
description: Join the exciting meet and greet sessions with Disney's beloved characters, Lilo and Stitch, at the Supertree Grove Lawn during the Children's Festival. These exclusive sessions offer a fantastic opportunity for children and families to interact with the characters, take memorable photos, and create lasting memories. Limited passes are available on a first-come, first-served basis, ensuring an intimate and special experience for attendees. Don't miss the chance to see your favorite characters up close and personal in this fun-filled environment. These sessions are a perfect highlight for fans of Lilo & Stitch, creating magical moments for all. [1, 5]
price_display: Free entry with limited passes (first come, first served) [1]

title: The Great Island Series Performance at Children's Festival 2025
description: Immerse yourself in 'The Great Island Series' performance, a captivating and entertaining show designed for families attending the Children's Festival at Gardens by the Bay. This engaging performance features dynamic dance routines, interactive games, and plenty of laughter, providing a delightful experience for kids and adults alike. It's a wonderful opportunity to enjoy live entertainment amidst the festival's vibrant atmosphere, making for a memorable family outing on select dates. This lively show enhances the overall festive spirit, encouraging audience participation and creating joyous moments for all at Supertree Grove Lawn. [1]

title: Garden Rhapsody: The Way to 'Ohana Light and Sound Show at GBTB
description: Experience the enchanting 'The Way to 'Ohana' special-edition Garden Rhapsody light and sound show at Supertree Grove, a highlight of the Children's Festival 2025. This spectacular nightly event brings the iconic Supertrees to life with synchronized lights and music, directly inspired by Disney's Lilo & Stitch. It offers a magical and immersive experience for families, showcasing a captivating display of visual and auditory artistry against the stunning backdrop of Gardens by the Bay. The show is a perfect evening activity for all ages, creating truly memorable moments during the festival and providing a grand finale to your day. [1, 3, 5]

title: Stitch-Themed Cosmic and Floral Craft Workshops at GBTB
description: Unleash your creativity at the Stitch-themed cosmic and floral craft workshops, part of the Children's Festival 2025 at Gardens by the Bay. These engaging workshops offer hands-on activities where participants can create unique items such as lanterns, slime, and leis. Perfect for fostering artistic skills and imagination, these sessions provide a fun and educational experience for children. Please note that all workshops come with a fee of $15 per person and take place on various dates and timings, which can be found on the official website. This provides flexibility for families to choose their preferred session and craft, making it a tailored learning experience within the festival. [1, 5]
datetime_display: Various dates and timings; refer to official website for details [1]
venue_name: Gardens by the Bay (Specific location for workshops not specified) [1]

title: Gallery Children's Biennale 2025 at National Gallery Singapore
description: The fifth edition of the Gallery Children's Biennale, themed 'Tomorrow We'll Be', is back at National Gallery Singapore. This year's edition coincides with the Gallery's 10th anniversary and the nation's 60th birthday, showcasing eight interactive art installations by local and international artists. These installations spotlight four core values: Joy, Kindness, Dream, and Love. For the first time ever, all artworks are baby-friendly, inviting kids of all ages and the young at heart to explore multi-sensorial installations that stimulate auditory and visual senses in a safe environment. Visitors are encouraged to think of the endless possibilities of their future through these engaging art experiences. The event also features a variety of kid-friendly programmes and workshops, including storytelling, adventure trails, and craft activities, most of which are free to join. Art Packs tailored for different age groups (ages six and under, and seven and up) are available, packed with art supplies and creative prompts inspired by the artworks.

title: National Vertical Marathon 2025: Scale Guoco Midtown
description: The National Vertical Marathon returns for its 2025 edition, challenging participants to race up Guoco Midtown in Singapore. This unique event offers various categories including Men's & Women's Open (16+), Veterans' Open (45+), NTU Alumni, Junior Climbers (10-16), Teams Open (4-5 runners), Duo Challenge (10+), and a Family Fun Run (3-5 family members). It's an unparalleled opportunity to test your endurance and take on a vertical challenge, promoting fitness in an urban environment. Kids aged 10 and above are invited to participate, making it a family-friendly event. Participants can choose to tackle the challenge individually or with a team, aiming to reach the summit of the tower. This event blends competitive running with the unique experience of ascending a skyscraper, offering a distinct physical and mental challenge.

title: SAFRA Diaper Dash 2025: Adorable SG60 Baby Race Fun
description: The adorable SAFRA Diaper Dash returns for its 2025 edition, featuring a special SG60 theme in partnership with Pororo Park. This event promises a delightful and fun-filled experience for the youngest participants, offering Pororo meet-and-greet sessions, sing-alongs, and exciting baby races. The race is open to little ones aged 6 to 36 months old, with six different age categories to ensure fair competition. It's a highly kid-friendly event designed to encourage early childhood activity in a playful and engaging environment. Parents can cheer on their babies and toddlers as they crawl, toddle, or walk towards the finish line, creating unforgettable family memories at Marina Square. Prizes are available for winners, adding to the excitement of this unique event for the entire family.

title: Income Eco Run 2025: Run for a Zero-Waste Lifestyle
description: The Income Eco Run 2025 is a prominent annual event dedicated to championing a zero-waste lifestyle, offering diverse race categories for competitive runners, families, children, and even pets. This year's edition introduces a new 1km Pets Category, inviting dogs and cats to join their owners. Adult categories include 3km, 5km, 10km, 15km, and 21.1km runs, while kids aged 4 to 12 can participate in 700m and 1km runs. For every kilometre completed, Income Insurance donates $1 to support the zero waste movement. The event, held at Marina Barrage, features routes past Singapore's iconic landmarks. It's an excellent opportunity to engage in physical activity while contributing to environmental sustainability, making it a meaningful outing for all participants. The run emphasizes green practices with plastic-free hydration and recycled event tees.
age_group_display: 4 years old and above, pets welcome

title: Smurfs Run 2025: Powered by JomRun, a Blue Fun Day
description: The Smurfs Run 2025, powered by JomRun, invites participants to transform Marina Barrage into a vibrant sea of blue on 28 June. This family-friendly weekend event offers non-competitive categories, including a 2km fun walk and a 4km fun run. All participants who complete their chosen distance will receive an exclusive Smurfs-themed finisher medal. Race packs, which contain additional Smurfs-themed keepsakes, should be collected prior to the event day. While there isn't a specific kids' category, junior fit tees are available for children aged 4 years and above, making it suitable for families to join in the fun. It’s an enchanting and active way to spend a weekend, immersing participants in the whimsical world of the Smurfs while promoting a healthy and active lifestyle for everyone involved.

title: Unlabelled Run 2025: Embrace Inclusivity, Drop Labels
description: The Unlabelled Run 2025 is a significant event dedicated to raising awareness about stigmatization and discrimination, advocating for a more inclusive, cohesive, and compassionate society. Organized by The New Charis Mission (TNCM), this run offers two main categories: a 5km fun run and a 10km competitive run. Participants aged 6 and above are encouraged to join, promoting the powerful message that 'labels do not matter, but people do.' Beyond being a physical challenge, it represents a social movement aimed at fostering an environment where individuals are valued for who they are, regardless of societal labels. The run specifically aims to support and empower youths, the elderly, ex-offenders, neurodivergent individuals, and the physically challenged, encouraging everyone to embrace their unique identities and contribute positively to society.

title: Cold Storage and Giant Kids Run 2025: Beach Fun
description: The Cold Storage and Giant Kids Run 2025 is a highly anticipated family-friendly marathon tailored for energetic young ones, relocating to the scenic Siloso Beach, Sentosa. This annual event features both competitive (1.6km & 2km) and non-competitive (1.6km) races, open to children aged 6 months to 12 years old, with strollers welcomed in the non-competitive category. Beyond the thrill of competition, where participants can win hampers worth up to $400 and trophies, the event also offers a complimentary Breakfast Run on 31 May 2025 at Marina Barrage, limited to the first 300 registrants as a warm-up. The run transforms the beach into a carnival-like experience, complete with sports obstacle challenges, a human claw machine, craft stations, sandcastle building, and bouncy castles, ensuring a day packed with active fun and entertainment for the entire family. It's an ideal opportunity to instill a love for fitness in children and create lasting family memories in a vibrant setting.

title: Crayon Shinchan Singapore Run 2025: Fun-Filled
description: The Crayon Shinchan Singapore Run 2025, powered by JomRun, offers a nostalgic and fun-filled experience for participants to engage in a healthy activity while celebrating the beloved manga character. This non-competitive event at Marina Barrage features two categories: a 2km fun walk and a 4km fun run. Participants will receive exclusive Crayon Shinchan race entitlements, including a cute bucket hat that cleverly doubles as a pouch, along with a unique finisher medal. While there isn't a dedicated kids' category, junior fit tees are available for children aged 4 years and above, making it a great outing for families. It's an opportunity to embrace fitness with a touch of whimsy, creating memorable moments for all ages in a lively and engaging environment.

title: Buff Forest Force Run 2025: Singapore's Toughest Trail
description: The Buff Forest Force Run 2025, known as Singapore's oldest and most challenging trail race, is designed for seasoned runners eager to push their physical limits. This multi-day event offers rigorous categories including 20km, 30km, and 50km runs, with a 10km event already completed on 4 May 2025. Participants will traverse diverse and scenic terrains through locations like Dairy Farm Nature Park, covering a mix of trail, concrete, gravel, and tarmac surfaces. A strict minimum age of 18 years old (as of 18 December 2024) is required for participation, ensuring the race is suited for adult endurance athletes. This event is a true test of grit and resilience, providing an immersive experience in Singapore's natural landscapes while challenging participants to conquer demanding routes. Runners are advised to carry their own hydration due to spread-out water points.
venue_name: MOE Dairy Farm Adventure Centre, Dairy Farm Road, Singapore 679058

title: Lazada Run 2025: Race, Shop, and Win Big Prizes
description: The Lazada Run 2025 makes its exciting return as a multi-country event across Southeast Asia, with the Singapore leg scheduled for 27 July 2025. This unique race blends the thrill of running with interactive shopping experiences, offering categories such as the 21.1km half marathon, 10km competitive run, 5km fun run, and the distinctive Lazada x POP MART 5km Run. Competitive runners in the 10km and 21.1km categories have the chance to win significant cash prizes. The 5km Fun Run also includes an engaging 'Voucher Snatch' challenge, where participants can literally run to grab deals. Designed for runners of all levels, from casual joggers to seasoned marathoners, this event is a dynamic celebration of movement and progress, featuring epic vibes, exclusive brand experiences, and fantastic rewards at the vibrant race village.

title: Running Lab Run 2025: Scenic Route at Marina Barrage
description: The Running Lab Run 2025 invites participants to an exhilarating and scenic race at Marina Barrage, offering two distinct categories: an easy 5km run and a challenging 10km competitive run. Runners will enjoy breathtaking views as they traverse the picturesque footpaths along Gardens by the Bay East and Tanjong Rhu, making it a visually rewarding experience. The event welcomes children aged 6 years old and up for the 5km run, while teenagers aged 16 years old and up can join the 10km competitive run. All registered participants will receive an exclusive event tee, a durable waterproof bag, a coveted finisher medal upon completion, an e-certificate, and a valuable 15% discount voucher for Running Lab stores. It is a prime opportunity to challenge oneself, achieve a personal best, and become an integral part of a vibrant running community amidst Singapore's iconic waterfront landmarks, promoting an active and healthy lifestyle with rewarding entitlements.

title: Pocari Sweat Run 2025: Hydration and Competitive Fun
description: The Pocari Sweat Run 2025 is set to return to Singapore, promising a dynamic event for runners of various abilities. This annual race, organized by the renowned Japanese isotonic drink brand, will take place at Marina Barrage and features three categories: a 2.4km fun run, a 5km run, and a 10km competitive run, along with supportive run workshops. Finishers of this Singapore marathon will be rewarded with cool Pocari Sweat-branded medals and race entitlements. The event is kid-friendly, welcoming children aged 4 years old and above to join the respective categories, making it suitable for families. Participants will enjoy stunning panoramic views as they race through downtown Singapore, passing by iconic landmarks and breathing in the refreshing air. It's an ideal event designed to promote health and wellness, offering a memorable experience for runners of all ages and fitness levels, with podium awards recognizing top finishers in each category.

title: Pink Ribbon Walk 2025: Awareness for Breast Cancer
description: The Pink Ribbon Walk is an annual walkathon organized to raise awareness and funds for the Breast Cancer Foundation, supporting breast cancer awareness initiatives. While the full details for the 2025 edition are still being announced, the event is confirmed to be family-friendly, welcoming children of all ages to participate. This walkathon serves as a vital platform for individuals and families to come together, contribute to a meaningful cause, and show solidarity with those affected by breast cancer. The funds and awareness generated through the walk are crucial for supporting research, providing essential services, and funding educational programs related to breast cancer in Singapore, ultimately making a significant impact on the fight against the disease. The event fosters a strong sense of community and collective action towards a healthier future for all.

title: Standard Chartered Singapore Marathon 2025: The Premier
description: The Standard Chartered Singapore Marathon (SCSM) 2025, widely recognized as Singapore's largest and most anticipated annual marathon, is set to captivate runners from all walks of life. With a rich history dating back to 1982, this iconic event welcomes participants of all ages and offers a comprehensive range of categories, including the full 42.195km marathon, 21.1km half marathon, 10km run, 5km run, the Kids Dash, Ekiden, and the Double Up Challenge. It's a highly anticipated race where participants often add to the vibrant atmosphere by donning fun costumes. The SCSM is celebrated for its world-class organization, enthusiastic spectators, and a truly inspiring experience through Singapore's vibrant streets and past iconic landmarks such as the F1 Pit Building and Marina Bay Sands. It serves as a significant opportunity for both seasoned marathoners and first-time participants to challenge themselves and be part of a major international sporting event.
venue_name: F1 Pit Building and Marina Bay area

title: Children's Season 2025 Stamp Booklet: Collect Prints & Win Prizes
description: Embark on an exciting journey at the Children's Museum Singapore with the Children's Season 2025 Stamp Booklet! This engaging program encourages young explorers to delve into Singapore's rich heritage by collecting unique stamp prints at various venues within CMSG and its Museum Roundtable partners. Participants will have the thrill of redeeming fun and educational prizes upon completion, making their visit not just a learning experience but also a rewarding adventure. This initiative is designed to ignite curiosity and foster a deeper connection with local culture in a playful and interactive manner, providing an unforgettable experience for all young visitors.

title: Tools and Treats: A Tasty Journey Through Singapore's Food Heritage
description: Join us for 'Tools and Treats: A Tasty Journey', an immersive workshop designed to explore Singapore's vibrant food heritage through engaging storytelling and exciting hands-on play activities. Children will embark on a culinary adventure, learning about traditional tools and ingredients that shape local cuisine. Each participant will receive a special take-home kit filled with delicious heritage snacks, allowing them to continue their discovery of Singaporean flavors even after the workshop concludes. This unique experience aims to educate and entertain, making cultural learning a truly delectable and memorable family affair at the Children's Museum Singapore.

title: For a Better Future: Interactive Theatrical Performance for Kids
description: Experience 'For a Better Future', a highly engaging and interactive theatrical performance designed to captivate young audiences at the Children's Museum Singapore. This dynamic show promises an abundance of laughter and sensory engagement, drawing participants directly into the narrative. Children won't just be spectators; they'll have the unique opportunity to become part of the performance, fostering creativity and active participation. This inspiring production aims to deliver a powerful message through entertainment, making it an enriching and memorable experience for families seeking both fun and meaningful learning opportunities within a vibrant setting.

title: Alien Vacation: A Cosmic Adventure Musical for Young Ones
description: Embark on an intergalactic journey with 'Alien Vacation: A Cosmic Adventure', a captivating kids' musical premiering at the Children's Museum Singapore. This enchanting production delves into themes of friendship and belonging through a vibrant narrative filled with memorable songs and exciting characters. As part of the immersive experience, every child participant will receive a mini toy camera, allowing them to capture their own memories of this out-of-this-world adventure. Designed to inspire imagination and promote positive values, this musical promises a delightful and educational escape for families, fostering a love for storytelling and exploration.

title: Class from the Past!: A Nostalgic Journey for Families Together
description: Step back in time with 'Class from the Past!', a unique and heartwarming experience at the Children's Museum Singapore designed to evoke nostalgia in parents while creating new, shared memories with their children. This special program offers a delightful glimpse into bygone eras, allowing families to explore and connect with Singapore's rich history in an interactive setting. Each child participant will receive a set of traditional 'kuti kuti' toys, adding an authentic touch to this educational and entertaining journey. It's an ideal opportunity for intergenerational bonding and discovering the charms of yesteryear.

title: Char Kway Teow Rhapsody: A Multi-Sensory Hawker Journey
description: Embark on a captivating 'Char Kway Teow Rhapsody', a unique multi-sensory journey that celebrates Singapore's beloved hawker trade, commencing from Armenian Street. This immersive experience at the Children's Museum Singapore invites visitors to explore the sights, sounds, and stories behind this iconic culinary heritage. Designed to engage all senses, the program offers an insightful look into the intricate processes and vibrant culture of hawker food. It's an unforgettable adventure that connects families with the rich traditions of local cuisine, making learning about Singapore's food landscape both fun and flavorful.

title: Time Travellers' Guide: Free Self-Guided Adventure at CMSG
description: Explore history at your own pace with the 'Time Travellers' Guide', a complimentary self-guided activity offered at the Children's Museum Singapore. This engaging experience invites young adventurers to embark on a journey through time, uncovering fascinating facts and stories about Singapore's past. Designed for independent exploration, it encourages critical thinking and observation as children navigate the museum's exhibits. While the program itself is free, a general admission ticket to the Children's Museum Singapore is required, ensuring access to a world of discovery and learning. It's an excellent way to dive deep into history creatively.

title: 3D Paper Lighthouse Craft: Free Creative Workshop for Kids
description: Unleash your creativity at the Children's Museum Singapore with the '3D Paper Lighthouse Craft' workshop, a fantastic free activity for young artists. This hands-on session provides all the materials and guidance needed for children to construct their very own three-dimensional paper lighthouse, inspired by Singapore's maritime history. It's an engaging opportunity to develop fine motor skills and artistic expression while learning about significant local landmarks. Although the workshop is free of charge, general admission to the Children's Museum Singapore is required to participate in this fun and educational crafting adventure, perfect for all budding creators.

title: Painting with Gems: Free Artistic Exploration for Young Minds
description: Spark your child's imagination with 'Painting with Gems', a captivating and free artistic workshop available at the Children's Museum Singapore. This unique activity allows children to create dazzling artworks using an array of colorful gems, fostering creativity and encouraging self-expression. Participants will learn about different textures and how to combine them to produce beautiful, sparkling masterpieces. While this workshop is complimentary, a general admission ticket to the Children's Museum Singapore is necessary to join in the fun. It's an excellent chance for kids to explore their artistic talents in a vibrant and supportive environment, making art both accessible and exciting.

title: Armenian Street Adventures with Bloopy and Friends: Self-Guided Fun
description: Embark on the 'Armenian Street Adventures with Bloopy and Friends', a delightful and free self-guided activity at the Children's Museum Singapore. This engaging experience invites young visitors to explore the historical Armenian Street through an interactive journey alongside charming characters Bloopy and Friends. It's an excellent opportunity for children to learn about local heritage and culture in a playful and exploratory manner, encouraging independent discovery. While participation in this self-guided adventure is free, a general admission ticket to the Children's Museum Singapore is required to access the museum premises and embark on this exciting educational quest.

title: Into the Hawkerverse: Exploring Singapore's UNESCO Hawker Culture
description: Dive 'Into The Hawkerverse' at the Children's Museum Singapore, a special exhibition dedicated to Singapore's iconic hawker culture, which was recognized as UNESCO's first inscription to the Representative List of Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity in 2020. This engaging exhibition was thoughtfully curated with insights from children themselves, providing a fresh and relatable perspective on this unique Singaporean heritage. Visitors will discover what goes into creating delicious, award-winning hawker dishes and delve into the vibrant world of local culinary traditions. The exhibition takes over the museum's second level, offering an immersive journey for all ages.

title: A Voyage Back in Time: Exploring Singapore's Origins for Kids
description: Embark on an extraordinary 'Voyage Back in Time' at Level 1 of the Children's Museum Singapore, where little ones can join Captain and WonderBot on an adventure to discover how Singapore came to be. Unlike traditional museums, this interactive exhibit encourages hands-on exploration, allowing kids to touch and engage with everything from picking up fruits and vegetables to climbing into a barber's chair. Highlights include an immersive show in The Hidden Chamber and playful elements like a mini boat and a ship. This journey culminates in the present day, where children can design their own stamps and send messages, offering a fun and educational dive into history.

title: Make a splash at teen-approved water parks in Singapore
description: Dive into fun at Singapore's top water parks, perfect for escaping the tropical heat. Wild Wild Wet offers thrilling rides like the Torpedo, while Adventure Cove Waterpark boasts attractions such as the Riptide Rocket and the serene Rainbow Reef. Teens can enjoy exhilarating slides, wave pools, and challenging obstacle courses, providing hours of splashy action and adrenaline-pumping excitement for all ages. It’s an ideal spot for thrill-seekers and those looking to cool down with friends.
venue_name: Wild Wild Wet (1 Pasir Ris Close) & Adventure Cove Waterpark (8 Sentosa Gateway)

title: Explore Singapore's beautiful parks and nature trails
description: Reconnect with nature and enjoy fresh air by exploring Singapore's expansive parks. Teens can cycle along scenic trails, embark on challenging treetop walks, or try ziplining through lush greenery. These wide-open spaces are also perfect for flying kites, playing sports, or simply relaxing on a picnic mat, offering diverse activities for every adventure level and a great way to spend quality time outdoors with friends or family.
price_display: Free entry; some activities may incur costs

title: Engage in thrilling escape room challenges in Singapore
description: Challenge your mind and work together with friends in an immersive escape room experience. Teens will uncover clues, solve intricate riddles, and piece together detailed storylines to find their way out. These games are not only fun but also foster critical thinking, teamwork, and problem-solving skills, making for an engaging and memorable group activity where players become characters in their own adventure, pushing their intellect to the limits.
price_display: Check individual escape room websites for pricing
venue_name: Various escape room venues in Singapore

title: Experience winter sports including skiing and surfing at Trifecta
description: Master winter sports right here in sunny Singapore at Trifecta, a destination designed for thrill-seekers of all skill levels. Whether you're a beginner or a pro, you can practice skiing or snowboarding on a dry slope, or learn to surf in the exhilarating wave pool. The venue also features a skateboard area and a cafe, making it the ultimate hangout spot for teens looking for unique and active experiences.
venue_name: 10A Exeter Road, beside Somerset Skate Park & Somerset MRT, Singapore 239958

title: Unleash energy with 34 exciting activities at SuperPark Singapore
description: SuperPark Singapore offers a revamped space with 34 thrilling activities, including 13 brand-new games, making it a perfect spot for older kids and young teens. Visitors can show off tricks in the Freestyle Hall, burn off energy in the Adventure Area, or engage in head-to-head competitions in the Games Arena. This indoor activity park ensures there's no shortage of fun, providing a vibrant and active environment for kids to stay entertained and physically engaged.
venue_name: 3 Temasek Boulevard, Suntec City Mall, #02-477 (North Wing), Singapore 038983

title: Conquer adrenaline-pumping water obstacles at HydroDash Sentosa
description: HydroDash Singapore, an exhilarating inflatable obstacle course in Sentosa, features over 30 adrenaline-pumping challenges, including 12 brand-new obstacles. Teens can test their agility and strength by scaling the towering Action Tower XXL, leaping off the Springboard into the waves, or getting launched sky-high with the 'Flip' activity, where friends or parents provide the boost for a big splash. It promises a splashing good time for competitive and active teens.

title: Channel your inner racer with thrilling go-karting experiences
description: For teens too young to drive a car, go-karting offers an exhilarating alternative to experience the thrill of racing. Maneuver high-speed karts around twisty tracks, challenging friends and family to an adrenaline-fueled competition. Singapore boasts various go-karting venues, including indoor options perfect for when the weather is too hot or rainy, ensuring a fun and competitive experience for budding racers eager to test their driving skills.
price_display: Check individual go-karting venues for pricing

title: Experience thrilling rides and attractions at Universal Studios Singapore
description: Located on Sentosa Island, Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit for teens seeking thrilling adventures. Popular rides include the intense Revenge of the Mummy, the dual-track Battlestar Galactica, and the immersive Transformers Ride. Visitors can also enjoy the Shrek 4D Adventure and explore the adorable new Minion Land, ensuring a day packed with excitement, cinematic experiences, and heart-pumping attractions suitable for teens and families alike, making it a firm favourite.

title: Overcome aerial challenges and zip lines at Forest Adventure
description: At Forest Adventure, teens can conquer heights and navigate challenging aerial obstacle courses. The Grand Course features 50 obstacles, including trapezes, bridges, and the infamous 'leap of faith', designed to test agility and courage. The experience culminates with four scream-inducing zip lines that send participants flying over the scenic Bedok Reservoir, offering an exhilarating outdoor adventure that combines physical activity with breathtaking views and a sense of accomplishment for teenagers.

title: Defy gravity with indoor skydiving experience at iFly Sentosa
description: Thrill-seeking teens can defy gravity at iFly on the Sentosa Beachfront, an indoor skydiving experience that simulates the exhilarating sensation of a real skydive within a controlled flight chamber. While it can be loud and windy, it offers a unique and unforgettable adrenaline rush for those looking for an extreme adventure without jumping from a plane. It's an ideal activity for bold teenagers eager to try something truly extraordinary.

title: Relax and de-stress with adorable felines at a cat cafe
description: Visiting a cat cafe in Singapore is a delightful and fool-proof activity for all ages, offering a perfect blend of relaxation, cuteness overload, and stress relief. Teens will love spending quality time with friendly resident felines, capturing adorable photos, and enjoying a comforting drink or treat in a cosy atmosphere. It's an ideal spot for animal lovers to unwind, bond over purring kitties, and escape the hustle and bustle of city life, providing a unique and charming experience.
price_display: Varies by cafe (entry fee or minimum spend)

title: Experience thrilling wakeboarding and wakesurfing on Singapore waters
description: For an exhilarating water sports experience, teens can try wakeboarding or wakesurfing in Singapore. Options include cable skiing and wakeboarding at Singapore Wake Park, where participants are pulled by a suspended motorized cable, perfect for beginners in the training area at East Coast Park lagoon. More experienced teens can opt for wakeboarding or wakesurfing with operators who tow them from a speedboat, offering a more challenging and dynamic ride on the open water.
venue_name: East Coast Park Lagoon & various wakeboarding operators

title: Challenge yourself with the Megazip at Mega Adventure Park
description: For teens seeking an ultimate challenge, Mega Adventure Park is home to the Megazip, an iconic 75-meter high, 450-meter long, and 50 km/ph flying fox. This thrilling zipline will give teenagers the flight of their life, soaring over the lush landscape of Sentosa. It's a perfect activity for thrill-seekers looking to push their limits and enjoy an unforgettable aerial adventure with breathtaking views, providing an adrenaline rush and a sense of accomplishment.

title: Scale new heights with indoor rock climbing in Singapore
description: For teens keen on action and physical challenges, indoor rock climbing offers an excellent outlet to burn energy and build strength. Singapore boasts numerous indoor climbing spots, including dedicated rock climbing centers and sky-high obstacle courses like those at Adventure HQ Khatib. These venues provide diverse routes and challenges suitable for various skill levels, allowing teenagers to scale new heights, improve their agility, and enjoy a rewarding workout in a safe, controlled environment.
venue_name: Various indoor rock climbing gyms in Singapore

title: Unleash creativity with a relaxing art jamming session
description: For teenagers seeking a calmer yet engaging activity, art jamming sessions provide the perfect creative outlet. Numerous studios across Singapore offer relaxed, no-pressure environments where teens can freely express themselves through painting. For an extra glow-up, some places even offer neon art jamming experiences, allowing participants to create vibrant artworks under UV lights. It's an ideal way to unwind, explore artistic talents, and enjoy a therapeutic and fun experience with friends.
venue_name: Various art jamming studios in Singapore

title: Tackle thrilling indoor adventure courses at Adventure HQ Khatib
description: Adventure HQ at HomeTeamNS Khatib is a premier indoor adventure hub featuring many first-of-its-kind courses specifically designed for tweens and teens. Highlights include Singapore's longest indoor slide, towering 4.5 stories high, and a two-tiered, 16-obstacle indoor challenge rope course. Teens can also brave the 15m Cloud Climb, explore indoor artificial caving, and experience Singapore's first 233m long indoor Roll Glider, ensuring an action-packed day of thrilling challenges and excitement.

title: Engage in heart-pounding laser tag battles across Singapore
description: Enter the thrilling realm of laser tag, where teenagers can transform into fearless warriors amidst neon-lit battlegrounds. These games are a perfect blend of strategy and teamwork, offering heart-pounding, glow-in-the-dark battles that challenge players to outwit their opponents. Numerous laser tag places across Singapore provide an exciting and competitive environment for teens to enjoy a high-energy group activity that promotes communication and strategic thinking, making for an unforgettable experience.
venue_name: Various laser tag venues in Singapore

title: Create custom rugs with a fun and satisfying tufting session
description: Tufting is a unique and satisfying art form where teens can create their own customized rugs using a tufting gun. Perfect for those who love to craft or express themselves through design, tufting workshops in Singapore allow participants to turn their creative ideas into fluffy works of art in just a few hours. It’s an engaging and hands-on activity that fosters creativity, offers a tangible takeaway, and might even spark a new shared hobby for teens and their friends.

title: Embark on a delicious ice cream adventure across Singapore
description: For teens with a sweet tooth, an ice cream adventure is always a great idea, turning a simple treat into a bonding experience. Explore some of Singapore's best ice cream spots, discovering artisanal gelato, fluffy waffles paired with ice cream, or unique local-inspired creations like ondeh-ondeh or teh tarik flavours. It’s a delightful way to satisfy cravings, explore different neighborhoods, and enjoy delicious desserts with friends, offering something for every kind of dessert lover.
venue_name: Various ice cream parlours and cafes in Singapore

title: Discover unique finds and vintage gems at local flea markets
description: Flea markets in Singapore are a treasure trove for teens, offering a goldmine of quirky finds, vintage gems, and affordable fashion that perfectly aligns with current trends. Whether they're hunting for Y2K accessories, retro tees, unique handmade trinkets, or simply enjoying the vibrant atmosphere, there's always something unexpected and exciting to uncover. It's a fantastic way for teenagers to explore their personal style, find one-of-a-kind items, and enjoy a fun, budget-friendly outing.
venue_name: Various flea markets and pop-up fairs in Singapore

title: Burn energy and have fun bouncing at a trampoline park
description: Trampoline parks in Singapore provide a perfect way for teens to get moving, burn off energy, and have a blast. With various fun trampoline spots available, teenagers can leap into a wide range of activities, from free jumping across interconnected trampolines to engaging in competitive dodgeball games or mastering acrobatic tricks. It’s an energetic and exhilarating activity that combines physical exertion with pure fun, making it a great option for active teens.

title: Explore the latest trends and food at Singapore's shopping malls
description: Shopping malls in Singapore have long served as popular hang-out spots for teens, offering more than just retail therapy. They are vibrant hubs where teens can fuel up on diverse food options, discover the latest fashion trends from blog boutiques like those in Far East Plaza, and explore exciting new developments such as Punggol Coast Mall or the revamped Cathay at Dhoby Ghaut. These malls provide a comprehensive experience for socializing, dining, and staying updated with fads.

title: British Council Young Learners Open House for Primary 1 Preparation (Napier Road)
description: The British Council Young Learners Open House offers parents an excellent opportunity to explore personalised English lessons for children, ideal for Primary 1 preparation and general language enrichment. Discover the British Council's effective teaching methods and MOE-aligned curriculum, delivered by experienced teachers. The event features free trial classes for Early Years to Secondary learners, showcasing interactive lessons that build confidence in English speaking, reading, and writing. Exclusive sign-up benefits include discounts up to S$175 on course fees, a S$60 registration fee waiver, and S$100 off a 10-hour private lesson package. Attendees can also win a 50% course discount (worth over S$1,000) with on-day sign-ups. This open house is crucial for parents seeking robust English enrichment programs, providing a direct understanding of how British Council supports linguistic development and academic readiness for young learners.
age_group_display: Early Years to Secondary learners (3-16 years)

title: British Council Young Learners Open House for Primary 1 Preparation (Toa Payoh)
description: The British Council Young Learners Open House offers parents an excellent opportunity to explore personalised English lessons for children, ideal for Primary 1 preparation and general language enrichment. Discover the British Council's effective teaching methods and MOE-aligned curriculum, delivered by experienced teachers. The event features free trial classes for Early Years to Secondary learners, showcasing interactive lessons that build confidence in English speaking, reading, and writing. Exclusive sign-up benefits include discounts up to S$175 on course fees, a S$60 registration fee waiver, and S$100 off a 10-hour private lesson package. Attendees can also win a 50% course discount (worth over S$1,000) with on-day sign-ups. This open house is crucial for parents seeking robust English enrichment programs, providing a direct understanding of how British Council supports linguistic development and academic readiness for young learners.

title: Embark on an exhilarating Phuket island-hopping adventure
description: Discover the breathtaking beauty of Phuket's surrounding islands, a quintessential family activity providing unforgettable experiences amidst Thailand's stunning marine landscape. This popular tourist attraction offers diverse island-hopping tours, easily booked with operators found across the island. Highlights include the famous Phi Phi Islands, known for their unique backpacker charm and serene, crystal-clear waters perfect for swimming and relaxation. For avid divers and snorkelers, the Similan Islands beckon with their vibrant, kaleidoscopic coral reefs teeming with exotic marine life, promising an immersive underwater exploration. Alternatively, Coral Island offers pristine white-sand beaches, ideal for sunbathing and various water sports. Most island-hopping excursions can be completed within a day, or even a half-day if you start early, allowing ample time to marvel at the spectacular natural beauty and rich marine ecosystems. These tours often provide opportunities for close encounters with the Andaman Sea's biodiversity, making it a fantastic educational and adventurous outing for children and adults alike, ensuring a memorable part of your Phuket itinerary.
venue_name: Phi Phi Islands, Similan Islands, Coral Island, and surrounding Phuket waters

title: Experience the bustling Naka Weekend Night Market in Phuket
description: Immerse your family in the lively atmosphere of Phuket's renowned Naka Weekend Night Market, an absolute must-visit for anyone seeking an authentic local experience. This vibrant market is a treasure trove of unique shopping opportunities, from local crafts and souvenirs to trendy beachwear, ensuring you find something special to take home. Food lovers will rejoice in the extensive array of delicious street food, offering an affordable culinary journey through Thai flavors, alongside charming cafes and fresh, cheap seafood. The market is also a hub for live entertainment, providing a captivating backdrop as you explore. Importantly, Naka Weekend Night Market offers a family-friendly environment, distinctly lacking the more 'adult' elements often found in markets like Patong Beach, making it a safe and enjoyable outing for all ages. While Naka is famous, Phuket boasts numerous night markets, including the Phuket Old Town Sunday Night Market and Kata Night Market, offering endless opportunities for evening exploration and cultural immersion.
venue_name: Naka Weekend Night Market, Wirat Hong Yok Rd, Wichit, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83000, Thailand

title: Connect with majestic elephants at Phuket Elephant Sanctuary
description: Discover a truly heartwarming and ethical animal encounter at the Phuket Elephant Sanctuary, a sprawling 30-acre haven dedicated to providing a natural and respectful home for rescued elephants. Located in the Thalang District, this sanctuary is committed to ethical practices, meaning visitors will not find any elephant shows or riding activities, ensuring the animals' well-being is paramount. Instead, families have the unique opportunity to observe these gentle giants in their natural habitat from Thailand's largest Canopy Walkway, spanning an impressive 500 meters. Guided tours offer insightful commentary on the elephants' stories and the sanctuary's conservation efforts, making it an educational experience for children and adults. For those who wish to contribute more, volunteering opportunities are also available. While other elephant sanctuaries exist on the island, the article strongly advises thorough research and review-reading to ensure ethical treatment of elephants, highlighting this sanctuary as a prime example of responsible tourism.
venue_name: Phuket Elephant Sanctuary, 100, Pa Klok, Thalang District, Chang Wat Phuket 83110, Thailand

title: Carnival Magic Phuket: A dazzling, family-friendly cultural show
description: Step into a world of wonder at Carnival Magic Phuket, a cultural theme park that promises an evening of unparalleled entertainment for the entire family. Known for its dazzling lights, vibrant colors, and over-the-top theatrics, this park delivers next-level entertainment that captures the imagination. Expect to be mesmerized by grand parades featuring elaborate floats, awe-inspiring acrobatics, thrilling funfairs, and large-scale cultural performances that showcase the rich heritage of Thailand in a spectacular fashion. The article highlights Carnival Magic Phuket as the more family-friendly option when compared to its counterpart, Phuket FantaSea, making it an ideal choice for parents seeking wholesome fun without concerns. It is designed to immerse visitors in a fantastical realm, offering a unique blend of traditional Thai artistry and modern entertainment technology, creating an unforgettable experience that will be a highlight of your Phuket family vacation.
venue_name: Carnival Magic Phuket, 999 Kamala, Kathu District, Phuket 83150, Thailand

title: Phuket FantaSea: Experience an extravagant cultural theme park
description: Immerse your family in the grandeur of Phuket FantaSea, an extravagant cultural theme park renowned for its dazzling lights, vibrant colors, and spectacular, over-the-top theatrics. This park offers a truly unique and entertaining experience, featuring elaborate parades, captivating acrobatics, lively funfairs, and massive cultural performances that bring Thai myths and legends to life on a grand scale. While offering thoroughly entertaining shows, it's important to note that Phuket FantaSea incorporates live animals in its performances, which may raise ethical considerations for some visitors. Despite this, the park remains a significant attraction for families seeking high-quality entertainment and a deep dive into Thai culture through a theatrical lens. The sheer scale and creativity of the productions make it a memorable outing, providing a sensory feast of sound, light, and performance that highlights the artistry and storytelling traditions of Thailand, making it a compelling option for evening entertainment.
venue_name: Phuket FantaSea, 99, Kamala, Kathu District, Phuket 83150, Thailand

title: Andamanda Phuket: A thrilling water park with Thai cultural flair
description: Dive into excitement at Andamanda Phuket, a premier water park that masterfully blends thrilling aquatic adventures with captivating Thai culture and myths. Nestled amidst traditional Thai architecture, the park features a diverse array of exhilarating water slides catering to all levels of thrill-seekers, from towering drops to winding flumes. Beyond the slides, families can unwind on lazy rivers, splash around in expansive wave pools, and enjoy various entertainment options scattered throughout the park. It's important to note that Andamanda Phuket is a highly popular attraction, especially during weekends and holiday seasons, so visitors should anticipate larger crowds and potentially longer wait times for the more sought-after slides. Despite the potential crowds, the park promises a full day of fun and refreshment, making it an ideal escape from the tropical heat and a fantastic way for families to create lasting memories while enjoying high-energy water-based activities.
venue_name: Andamanda Phuket, 333, Kathu, Kathu District, Phuket 83120, Thailand

title: Central Festival Phuket: Shopping, aquarium, and art for families
description: Escape the sun or rain at Central Festival Phuket, the island's premier shopping mall offering a vast array of modern retail stores, renowned designer brands, and a diverse selection of restaurants for every palate. This air-conditioned haven provides a comfortable and convenient environment for families to shop, dine, and relax. Beyond traditional retail therapy, Central Festival Phuket is home to two major family attractions: Aquaria Phuket, proudly Thailand's largest aquarium, where visitors can explore a mesmerizing underwater world teeming with diverse marine life; and Phuket's very own Trick Eye Museum, an interactive 3D art museum perfect for captivating photos and playful engagement. This makes the mall not just a shopping destination but a comprehensive entertainment complex, ideal for a full day of family fun, cultural exploration, and leisurely indulgence, providing a perfect indoor alternative for any weather condition.
price_display: Free entry to mall, paid entry for attractions
venue_name: Central Festival Phuket, 74,75 Moo5, Vichit, Muang, Phuket, 83000, Thailand

title: Wander through the charming and historic Phuket Old Town
description: Uncover a different side of Phuket by exploring the charming and historically rich Phuket Old Town, an ideal destination for curious little explorers and families seeking cultural immersion beyond the beaches. This vibrant area is distinguished by its beautifully preserved Sino-Portuguese buildings, intricate street art that tells local stories, serene shrines, and bustling markets, offering a fascinating glimpse into the island's heritage. While a day trip can provide an adequate overview of the key attractions, avid travelers recommend spending at least two days to truly soak in the local culture, delve deeper into its history, and discover hidden gems. Walking through its narrow streets allows for unique photo opportunities and interactions with local vendors, making it a perfect spot for leisurely exploration and discovery. The blend of architectural beauty, artistic expression, and authentic local life makes Phuket Old Town a captivating and enriching experience for visitors of all ages.
price_display: Free to explore, pay for purchases

title: Discover Phuket's diverse and breathtaking family-friendly beaches
description: Indulge in the quintessential Phuket experience by exploring its abundant and diverse array of stunning beaches, each offering a unique ambiance for families. From the lively and most popular Patong Beach, known for its vibrant energy and extensive amenities (though also with adult entertainment, which families should be aware of), to the more serene and laid-back options, there's a perfect stretch of sand for everyone. Karon Beach, a long expanse of pristine white sand, and Kata Beach, celebrated for its excellent surfing conditions and watersports, provide popular yet relaxed alternatives south of Patong. For families seeking a quieter and more secluded getaway, Kamala Beach, Surin Beach, and Nai Harn Beach offer tranquil shores and peaceful environments, ideal for relaxation and quality family time. These beaches provide endless opportunities for swimming, sunbathing, building sandcastles, and enjoying the natural beauty of the Andaman Sea, making them a cornerstone of any Phuket family vacation.
venue_name: Various beaches in Phuket (Patong, Karon, Kata, Kamala, Surin, Nai Harn)

title: Macbeth on Roblox: Immersive Game by Singapore Repertory Theatre
description: Macbeth on Roblox is a new immersive game by Singapore Repertory Theatre (SRT), launched on 7 May 2025. It allows students to explore William Shakespeare's Macbeth in a stylized, sci-fi version. Players roleplay as Macbeth, making key decisions and facing consequences of ambition. Developed with the National Arts Council, it serves as an educational tool supporting MOE's Literature in English curriculum, helping students understand and appreciate the story. It's a unique and fun way to introduce teens to the classic tale and can be used as a pre-show exploration for Shakespeare in the Park – Macbeth. The game will have exciting content updates, including new scenes over time.

Mandai ZooSchool offers 'Wild Wonders @ Singapore Zoo', a thrilling educational card game called the Trump Challenge for kids aged 5 to 12. Children work in teams to learn about the animal kingdom, animal traits, and practice strategic decision-making and problem-solving skills to win the mission through this fun, fast-paced card game. This program is designed to foster curiosity, resilience, teamwork and a deep appreciation for wildlife and conservation through interactive, hands-on activities.
title: Wild Wonders @ Singapore Zoo: Exciting card game challenge

description: WILD Rescue Rangers is a full-day, eight-hour program for kids aged 7 to 12. With a blend of indoor and outdoor activities, kids will learn essential first aid skills to handle minor injuries, care for wildlife, and practice problem-solving for real-world challenges. Activities include feeding elephants at Singapore Zoo and embarking on a rescue mission at ZooSchool. The program also includes a buffet lunch. This highly sought-after, interactive experience promises unforgettable animal encounters and practical life skills.
datetime_display: August and September (full-day programmes over three days)
title: WILD Rescue Rangers: Wildlife interactions & first aid skills
Go Green SG Guided Walk at Chestnut Nature Park: Discover hidden gems and endangered residents
description: Explore Chestnut Nature Park with a free, volunteer-led guided walk on 7 June. Uncover the park's rich history, learn about its fascinating plant life, and potentially spot endangered residents like the mousedeer. This walk is guided by local residents, offering plenty of insider knowledge about one of Singapore's hidden green gems. It's an outdoor adventure designed to turn kids into eco-warriors and connect families with nature, as part of the broader Go Green SG initiative by the Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment. This activity promotes sustainability through direct engagement with Singapore's natural environment.

title: City Sprouts Urban Farm Tour and Mindful Tea Workshop: Explore sustainable farming methods and food waste solutions
description: Join a 60-minute guided farm tour at City Sprouts' flagship urban farm in Henderson. This interactive experience features six stations where you'll discover various farming methods, meet resident chickens, and learn about composting and bio-digesters for sustainable food waste management. Following the tour, unwind with a mindful tea workshop designed to encourage reflection on your relationship with food, others, and yourself. This event is part of Go Green SG, a nationwide movement by the Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment, aimed at inspiring families to embrace sustainable living through engaging and educational activities.
price_display: Price not specified, likely free or low cost

title: Sustainability Shopping Learning Journey with WWF at FairPrice: Make smarter food choices and fight food waste
description: Embark on a Sustainability Shopping Learning Journey with the World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF) at FairPrice's flagship sustainable store at City Square Mall. This program empowers children to explore how they can make smarter food choices, understand eco-labels, discover ways to reduce packaging and waste, and pick up practical tips to fight food waste at home. This initiative is part of Go Green SG, a nationwide movement by the Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment, designed to inspire families to adopt sustainable practices through engaging and educational experiences, fostering a new generation of eco-conscious citizens.
price_display: Price not specified, likely free or low cost
organiser: World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF) and FairPrice

title: Wings of Art: Contribute to a butterfly-themed installation and support underprivileged children
description: Participate in Wings of Art, an event organised by Peace of Art SG and Wings of Childhood, running from 24 June to 1 July. Contribute your creativity to a breathtaking butterfly-themed installation symbolising hope and renewal. Witness a unique 60-meter-long Barbie runway made from upcycled wine crates and brought to life by 60 Singaporean artists and artisans. You can also join by creating your own winged Barbie doll using repurposed materials. 100% of the proceeds from the event go towards supporting education and mentorship for underprivileged children, and the dolls made will be gifted to them. This event combines creativity with a noble cause.
price_display: Price not specified, likely free or low cost (proceeds go to charity)
organiser: Peace of Art SG and Wings of Childhood
venue_name: Venue not specified, likely part of Go Green SG

title: Free Trial Class for Girls Aged 5-15 at International Girls Choir Open Houses
description: The International Girls Choir (IGC) from the International School of Performing Arts offers free trial classes at their Open House events in May and June, open to girls aged 5 to 15. The IGC provides a supportive, all-girls environment for developing confidence, skills, public speaking, presentation skills, teamwork, and building friendships, with no prior performing arts experience required. These open houses allow girls to try a free class, take part in an optional assessment workshop, and receive a personalized report. Scholarship opportunities are available for those with potential for the audition-based Performing Choir. Rehearsal locations include Tanglin, Serangoon, and new venues in Dhoby Ghaut, Bencoolen, and Katong.
organiser: International School of Performing Arts - International Girls Choir
venue_name: International School of Performing Arts (ISPA), Tanglin, Serangoon, Dhoby Ghaut, Bencoolen, Katong
